div0.head: *w
div0.entryFree:
*w, w)=, to/, twenty-fourth and last letter of the Ionic alphabet, a)po\ a)/lfa e(/ws .w. Gloss.iii 283 (ix A. D.); thence used as a symbol of
the end, the last, e)gw/ ei)mi to\ a)/lfa kai\ to\ w)= (not to\ w)= me/ga) Apoc.1.8, al.:—as a numeral w/ = 800, but wNUM = 800,000. The epichoric Att. and other alphabets of the Inscrr. had used o in differently to represent the sounds of the later o and w : *w is a differentiated form of o, and, though usu. = w, was used in the Ionic islands of Paros, Thasos, and Siphnos with the value o, while O or O represented the sound w. The name of the letter was to\ w)= (perispom. acc. to Hellad. ap. Phot.p.530B.), cf. Achae.33.3, Pl.Phdr.244d, Cra. 420b, Tht.203c: after the loss of the distinction betw. long and short vowels, o and w had the same pronunciation; they begin to be confused in Papyri of iii B. C. (oi)kwno/mou PRev.Laws 50.22 (iii B. C.)), but the name w me/ga appears first in later Greek, Theognost.Can. 13; kata\ sxh=ma diplou= w_ h)/toi mega/lou Eust.869.26; oi( de\ peri\ *)ari/starxon au)to\ to\ poth/rion w_ me/ga ei)=nai/ fasin, o(poi=n i)/sws to\ kata\ du/o u_ e)sxhmatisme/non Id.869.29; e)n tw=| w_ mega/lw| under
omega (in a lexicon), Id.1828.49: dia\ tou^ w_ mega/lou Hdn.Epim.208.

w)= and w)/, an exclamation, expressing surprise, joy, or pain,
O! oh! with nom., w)\ ta/las e)gw/ S.Aj.981, etc.; w)\ e)/benos, w)\ xruso/s Theoc.15.123: also c. gen., w)\ th=s a)naisxunti/as Luc.Pisc.5; with interrog., w)/, ti/ le/geis; Pl.Prt.309d; in the middle of a sentence, E.Hipp.362 (lyr.), al. with voc., a mode of address, whether at the beginning of a sentence or in a parenthesis, w)= *)axileu= Il.1.74, etc., esp. in dialogue and Oratt., e)boulo/mhn, w)= a)/ndres, th
 du/namin ktl. Antipho.5.1; in invocations of the gods, w)= *zeu= te kai\ *gh= kai\ polissou=xoi qeoi/ A.Th.69, etc.; with imper., w)= xai=re Id.Ag.22, S.Aj. 91; w)= pro\s qew=n u(/peike ib.371, cf. D.21.98: sts. following the Verb, E.Tr.335 (lyr.); in different number from the voc., prose/lqet', w)= pai=, patri/ S.OC1104, cf. 1112, Sch.Ar.Pl.66. with nom. instead of voc., w)= di^os ai)qh/r, w)= fi/los, A.Pr.88, 545; w)= gennai=os Pl. Phdr.227c; w)= ou(=tos *ai)/as S.Aj.89; w)= ou(=tos ou(=tos *oi)di/pous Id.OC 1627; also ou(=tos, w)= se/ toi (sc. kalw=) Ar.Av.274. with both together, fi/los w)= *mene/lae Il.4.189; w)= tla/mwn pa/ter S.Aj.641 (lyr., tla=mon codd. rec., edd.). with the latter of two nouns, *)aga/memnon, w)= *mene/lae Id.Ph.794.—In the first sense usu. written w)/, in the second w)= : [to\ w)\] h(ni/ka qaumastiko
 lamba/netai baru/netai, kai\ xwrei^ ei)s e)pirrhmatikh
 su/ntacin, oi(=on w)\ *(hraklh=s EM79.13: Thom.Mag. p.408R. prescribes w)\ with the gen., but w)= with the voc., e.g. w)= *(hra/kleis, where the whole expression, and not merely the w)/ （w)=,) expresses surprise (but A.D.Adv.127.24 seems to imply w)= in both senses); w)/ as an exclam. is found in forms like w)/ moi, w)/ moi e)gw/, w)\ pro\s tw=n qew=n D. l. c.: but w)= po/poi dusi\ to/nois xrh=tai Hdn.Gr.1.503, so that w)\ po/poi is improbable, cf. Theognost.Can.158 (as emended by Lehrs Aristarch.3p.119); w)/|moi and w)/moi are both recognized by EM822.33, cf. Lex.Mess.p.413; wim' Sapph.Supp.23.4; in E., when it stands in the middle of a sentence, it shd. be written w)/, Hipp.362, al.: sts. doubled, w)\ w)\ kaka/ A.Ag.1214; i)w\ w)\ w)/ S.OC 224 (v.l. w(\ w(\ w(\); written w\ w/ in Pap. of S.Ichn.61; tripled, w)\ w)\ w)/ A.Pers.985 (lyr., prob.). To those who (like D.T.640.11, cf. Sch. D.T.p.257H.) took w)= for the voc. of the Art. o(, A.D.Synt.45.22-53 replies at length.

w(/, Dor. for w(s, A.D.Pron.48.27, Synt.156.22, al. Dor. for o(/qen, Leg.Gort.10.36, SIG47.21 (Locris, v B. C.), Theoc.3.11, al.; w(= toi\ li/qoi . . (
from which the stones . . ) shd. be read in IG4.823.66, cf. 33 (Troezen, iv B. C.): formed like Dor. voi/kw = oi)/koqen.

w(=, Dor. for w(=de,
hither, fe/r' w(= ta\n sku/laka Sophr. in Stud.Ital. 10.123.

w)/|a (A), h(, = mhlwth/,
sheepskin, Hermipp.57 (anap.), cf. Poll.10.181, Hsch.; ste/gasma, ei)/ ti bo/leste, a)pope/myai h)\ w)/as h)\ difqe/ras w(s eu)telesta/tas kai\ mh\ sisurwta/s SIG1259 (Athens, iv B. C.).
garment of this material, a sort of
drawers or
apron, used by bathers, perizwsa/menos w)/|an loutri/da, kata/desmon h(/bhs Theopomp.Com.37;
w)/|an lou/menos (Bentl. for loume/nw|） prozw/nnutai Pherecr.62; worn at certain sacred rites, Hermipp.53 (anap.). = o)/a (B).1,
border or
fringe of a garment, = to\ kra/spedon tou= i(mati/ou, Ar. ap. Lex.Mess. p.411 (su\n tw=| i_, but Phot. and Eust. cite (Fr.228) the same play for o)ai\ tw=n i(mati/wn）; th\n w)/|an tou= e)ndu/matos LXXPs.132(133).2, cf. Gal.18(1).776, dub. cj. in Aen.Tact.31.23 (bis); w)/|an e)/xon ku/klw| tou= peristomi/ou, e)/rgon u(fa/ntou, i(/na mh\ r(agh=| LXXEx.28.28, cf. 36.31; Eust. speaks of the xrush= w)/|a of Odysseus, 1828.53. generally,
edge, e)s ta\n a)/nw w)i/an ta=s pe/tras GDI5075.59 (Crete); h( w)/a tou= a)/ntrou th=s mega/lhs pe/tras h)=n to\ mesai/taton Longus 1.4; ta\n bwi/an (i. e. vwi/an） *)oruko/ppan GDI5024A24 (Crete); stefa/nusi [de/] e(kat' w)/ian e)ko/smion
summit, dub. in Corinn.Supp.1.26.—Gramm. vary in spelling, o)/a Poll.7.62, Hdn.Gr.2.271; o)/a and w)/|a Hsch.; w)=|a Theognost.Can.106; w)=a Eust. (v. supr.), quoting Ael.Dion.Fr.266 (whose lexicon gave both o)/a and w)=|a) and an anonymous lexicon which gave o)ai\ i(mati/wn （o)cuto/nws kai\ sunestalme/nws, = Ar.Fr.228): SIG1259 (v. supr.) is by a half-educated writer: Eust. considers w)/|a to be contr. from oi)e/h or o)i/+a, 877.53, 1828.51.
w)/a (B), v. w)ba/, cf. oi)/h (A).
w)aiai/, exclam. of pain, A.D.Adv.127.31; also w)/|ai Aeol. for w)aiai/ ib.128.2, cf. Theoc.30.1, Lex.Mess.p.412 (su\n tw=| i_).

w)|a/rion [a^], to/, Dim. of w)|o/n,
small egg, Ephipp.24, Anaxandr.77, BGU781v6: w)a/ria sidhra= Hsch. s.v. kua/qous.
*)wa^ri/wn, *)wa^riw/neios, v. sub *)wri/wn.

w)as, to/, Dor. for ou)=as, ou)=s,
ear, Sophr. in Stud.Ital.10.123, cf. Hdn.Gr.2.921; w)/ata and w)/asin are cited by Hsch.:—hence seems to be formed the fut. w)a^twqh/sw, = a)kou/somai, Id., Phot.; w)atoqhsw= Suid.; Dor. word, acc. to Phot. and Suid.

w)/aton, to/,
tub, Hero
*Stereom.2.21.

w)b-a/, h(, in Laconia, a local division of the Spartan people, IG5 (1).26.11 (ii/i B. C.), 27.18; oi( nika/santes ta\s w)ba/s ib.675, al.; w). *limnae/wn ib.688; w)ba\s w)ba/cai Plu.Lyc.6:—cf. ou)ai/: fulai/, Hsch. (ou)a=| (dat.) shd. perh. be read in an Inscr. from Orcistus, cf. JHS 57.247 (iii A. D.)) (prob. Cypr. or Thess.); w)/as: ta\s kw/mas, Hsch. (b represents the digamma, cf. w)gh/: kw/mh, Id.)

w)b-a/zw,
divide the people into w)bai/, v. foreg.
w)ba/lleto: diwqei=to, Hsch. w)ba/tas: tou\s fule/tas, Id. (w)ba/tous cod.); cf. w)ba/.

w)/beon, to/, (i. e. w)/veon)
egg, and w)beoko/pths, ou, o(,
egg-breaker, name of a species of snake, Hsch.

w)=bos, o(, dub. sens. in dh\s [i. e. di\s] deka/das d' e)te/wn plh/sas kei=mai tw=d' u(po\ w)/bw Keil-Premerstein
Zweiter Bericht No.145 (near Thyatira, ca. i B. C.); cf. w)=boi: to/poi megalomerei=s, Hsch. (sed leg. w)bai/）
w)/brato: ei(/marto, Hsch. (Perh. cf. o)mei/romai.）
w)/ga^non, to/, = knhmi/s 11, AB318, Hsch.

*wgenos, o(, = *)wkeano/s, Lyc.231, St.Byz., etc.; *)wghno/s Pherecyd. Syr.Fr.2.D.; *)wgh/n, h=nos, Hsch.:—hence *)wgeni/dai = *)wkeani/dai, Id.; and w)ge/nios, a, on, = a)rxai=os, w). *stugo\s u(/dwr Parth.Fr.7. cf. w)ge/nion: palaio/n, Hsch.
w)gh/, v. w)ba/; also expld. by fa/laggos to\ e)/sxaton, kai\ to\ a)/kron (i. e. w)/|a), Hsch.

w)gmo/s, o(, (w)/zw)
a crying oh! Hsch., cf. A.Eu.123,126.

*)wgu^gi/a, h(,
Ogygia, a mythical island in the Mediterranean, the abode of Calypso, Od.1.85 (written *)wguli/h by Antim., Sch. l.c.). epith.(?) of
Egypt, Eust.ad D.P.239. of Attica and
Boeotia, St.Byz. an island west of Britain in which Kronos was imprisoned, Plu.2.941a.

*)wgu/gios [u^], a, on, A. Th.321 (lyr.), but in Trag. mostly os, on:—
Ogygian, of or
from Ogyges, a mythical king of Attica: hence generally,
primeval, primal, *stugo\s u(/dwr Hes.Th.806; w). pu=r Emp. 84.7; *fliou=ntos u(p' w)gugi/ois o)/resin Pi.N.6.44 (w)gugi/oi' Bgk.); ta\s w). *qh/bas A.Pers.37 (anap.), cf. S.OC1770 (anap.); ta\s w). *)aqa/nas A.Pers.975 (lyr.), cf. Th.l.c.; ga=s u(po keu/qesin w). Id.Eu.1036 (lyr.); se\ . . to/d' e)lh/luqen pa=n kra/tos w)gu/gion
from earliest ages, S.Ph.142 (lyr.).
gigantic, Hld.10.25.
w)|da/rion [a^], to/, Dim. of w)|dh/, Arr.Epict.3.23.21, Longin.41.2, Petron.53.

w(=de, Att. also w(di/ (q. v.), demonstr.Adv. of o(/de: of Manner,
in this wise, thus, sts.
so very, so exceedingly, freq. from Hom. downwards: in Hom. usu. before the Verb, but after it in Il.1.181, 574, 10.91, 18.392; Pl. and X. mostly place it after the Verb:—in construction w(=de is answered by w(s,
so . . , as . . , Il.3.300, Od.19.312: answering w(/s per, Il.6.478, cf. S.OT276, etc.: folld. by a relat., ti/s w(=de tlhsika/rdios, o(/tw| . . ; A.Pr.160 (lyr.); by ei), dokw= moi w(=de a)\n ma=llon piqe/sqai soi, ei)/ moi dei/ceias . . Pl.Cra.391a; ei) fronw=n e)/prasson, ou)d' a)\n w(=d' e)gigno/mhn kako/s S.OC272: c. part., du/ais te kamfqei\s w(=de desma\ fugga/nw A.Pr.513: w(=de/pws is freq. in Att., Pl.R.393d, X.Mem. 2.1.21, etc.; also in later Prose, Luc.Herm.32, etc. of a State or Condition,
as it is, pro/mol' w(=. come forth
just as thou art, Il.18.392, cf. Od.1.182, 2.28 (rightly so taken by Aristarch. ap. Sch.A Il.2.271, cf. Sch.A Il.18.392: v. infr. 11); streu/gesqai w(=d' a)/tws Il.15.513, cf. 10.91. of something following,
thus, as follows, esp. to introduce quoted words, Il.1.181 (where it follows the verb), Od.2.111, Hes. Op.203, etc.; w(=d' h)mei/yato S.Ph.378: sts. referring to what goes before, Hdt.5.2. pleon., to/son w(=d' e)bo/hsas Od.9.403; w(=de . . th=|de S.El.1301. c. gen., ge/nous me\n h(/keis w(=. toi=sde (where h(/keis = prosh/keis) E.Heracl.213. of Place,
hither, cf. o(/de 1: Aristarch. denied this usage in Hom. altogether (cf. Sch.A Il.2.271, Apollon.Lex. s.v. w(=de, A.D.Adv.178.25, Eust.792.2, al.); and most of the passages taken in this sense may be referred to signf.1.1 or 2,
just as you see, v. supr.1.2: but
hither seems prob. in Od.17.544, Il.12.346, 10.537: examples of w(=de,
hither, are found in Trag. (esp. in S., as OT7,144, 298, OC182 (lyr.), 841 (lyr.), 1206, 1547, Tr.402); also in Com., as i)/tw tis w(=. Ar.Av.229 (lyr.); and later, as Herod.1.49; xili/as w(=. kai\ xili/as w(=d' e)mbalei=n Id.5.48; w(=. xw)=de xaskeu/sh| Id.4.42; w(=de kai\ w(=de
this way and
that, AP5.128 (Autom.): prosa/gage w(=. to\n ui(o/n sou Ev.Luc.9.41.
here, Herod.2.98; ei)si\n w(=. pro\s h(ma=s they are
here with us, Ev.Marc.6.3; w(=. ka)kei= Plu. 2.34a, cf. Ev.Marc.13.21: thnei= dru/es, w(=de (v.l. h)de\） ku/peiros Theoc. 1.106, cf. 120, 121: so Cratin.54 (anap.) acc. to Phot. (but v. Kock).

w(/deqen, Adv.
from this neighbourhood, o)nhla/tas misqw/sasqai PCair.Zen.164.2 (iii B. C.).

*)widei=on, to/,
the Odeum, a public building at Athens built by Pericles
for musical performances (w)|dai/), having an orchestra, And. 1.38, IG22.1688.3, Eup.18D.; and other apparatus of a theatre, Paus. 1.8.6, 1.14.1; used as a law-court, Ar.V.1109 (troch., cf. Sch.), D.59.52; for philos. disputations, Alex.25.2, D.L.7.184, Plu.2.605a; for soldiers' quarters, X.HG2.4.9,24; as a place for distributing corn, D.34.37: it seems to have been circular, with a peaked roof, whence the line of Cratin.71, o( sxinoke/falos *zeu\s o(di\ prose/rxetai o( *perikle/hs, tw)|dei=on e)pi\ tou= krani/ou e)/xwn, cf. Plu.Per.13, Thphr. Char.3.4: rebuilt, after having been burnt, by Ariobarzanes, App. Mith.38. of other
music-halls, as that at Athens, built by Herodes Atticus, Paus.7.20.6; at Corinth, Id.2.3.6; at Patrae, Id.7.20.6; at Patara, Epigr.Gr.412; at Samos, GDI5702.41 (iv B. C.); at Rome, built by Hadrian, D.C.69.4; qeatroeide\s w)|. CIG4614 (Palestine).

w)|dh/, h(, contr. for a)oidh/,
song, lay, ode, h.Ap.20, h.Cer.494; in Trag. (exc. that A. uses only a)oidh/ (q. v.)), of dirges, polla\s qrh/nwn w)|da/s S.El.88 (anap.); o)cuto/nous w)|. qrhnh/sei Id.Aj.631 (lyr.); w)|da\ e)pikh/deios E.Tr.514 (lyr.); but also of
joyful songs, songs of praise, kalli/nikos Id.El.865 (lyr.); i)/akxos Id.Cyc.69 (lyr.); lu/pas poluxo/rdois w)|. pau/ein Id.Med.197 (anap.); w)|da\s u(ste/roisi qh/sete Id.Supp.1225; xai/rontes w)|dh=s . . me/lesin Ar.Ra.244(lyr.); u(menai/ois kai\ numfidi/oisi de/xesq' w)|. Id.Av.1729(lyr.): freq. in Pl., w)|. kiqarw|dikh/ Lg.722d; kiqari/zein pro\s th\n w)|. Alc.1.108a; w)|dai\ kai\ h( a)/llh poi/hsis
lyric poetry and . . , Phdr.245a; e)n tai=s w)|dai=s kai\ me/lesin R.399c, cf. 398c; opp. le/cis, Lg.816d; e)n w)|dai=s kai\ mu/qois kai\ lo/gois ib.664a; of poems such as those of Stesichorus on Helen, Isoc.10.64; of the various songs associated with particular employments or conditions, Clearch.37, cf. Eust.1164.10, 1236.60. = e)pw|do/s,
magic song, spell, Longus 2.7. meton. for xordh/, *te/rpandros . . de/ka zeu=ce *mou=san e)n w)|dai=s Tim.Pers.238.
singing, Plu.Crass.33, etc.; of birds, Arist.HA613b24.
w(di/ [i_], Att. strengthd. form of w(=de, w(. kexhnw/s Ar.Pax57, cf. Nu.690, Pl.Prt.353c, Grg.477c, al., Plot.6.4.8; never in Trag.

w)|diko/s, h/, o/n,
musical, as Subst.,
musician, Ar.Fr.8D., Arist.EE 1238a36, etc.; opp. r(htoriko/s, Plu.2.622a; opp. o)rxhstiko/s, Theopomp.Hist.111（
a); of animals, opp. a)/nw|dos, Arist.HA488a34; w)|dikw/teros ku/knwn Luc.Tim.47, cf. DMar.1.5 (Comp.), Electr.4; o)/rniqes tw=n w)|dikw=n Ael.VH14.30. Adv. -kw=s Ar.V.1239, Pl.Com.8D.: Comp. -w/teron Luc.Sat.4.
w)di/n, h(, v. w)di/s.

w)di_nolu/ths [u^], ou, o(,
setting free from pain, name of a kind of shell-fish, Plin.HN32.6.

w)di/nw [i_], used by early writers only in pres.: fut. w)di_nh/sw LXX Hb.3.10: aor. w)/di_na AP7.561 (Jul.Aeg.), Opp.C.1.5, Jul.Or.2.56d; w)di/nhsa LXXPs.7.15:—so aor. Med. and Pass., w)dinhsa/mhn, -h/qhn, Aq.Ps.113(114).7, Pr.8.25:—
to have the pains of childbirth, be in travail, w(s d' o(/tan w)di/nousan e)/xh| be/los o)cu\ gunai=ka Il.11.269; w)di/nein trome/w: xalepo\n be/los *ei)leiqui/as Theoc.27.29, cf. Ar.Th.502, Ec.529, Hp.Epid.5.25, Pl.R.395e, etc. c. acc.,
to be in travail of a child,
bring forth, E.IA1234, LXXCa.8.5: of animals, w). neottou/s Ael.NA 2.46: prov., w)/dinen o)/ros Luc.Hist.Conscr.23. metaph. of any great pain,
to be in travail or
anguish, of the Cyclops, stena/xwn te kai\ w)di/nwn o)du/nh|si Od.9.415; *ku/pridi AP7.30 (Antip.Sid.);
labour painfully, w)di/nousi me/lissai ib.9.363.22 (Mel.(?)); of the mind,
to be in the throes or
agonies of thought, Pl.Tht.148e, al.; kuou=me/n te kai\ w). peri\ e)pisth/mhs ib.210b; u(pe\r dissw=n mi/an w)di/nein yuxh/n E.Hipp. 258 (anap.); w(/ste m' w)di/nein ti/ fh/|s what you mean, S.Aj.794, cf. E. Heracl.644; w)di/nein ei)/s ti
to long painfully for a thing, Hld.5.32: c. inf., Id.2.21, Him.Ecl.13.38, Or.4.1: c. acc., Hld.10.31; e)/codon Chor.42.20 p.517 F.-R.
worry, fuss, w)di/nonta mh/pote lh/gein peri\ tou= sw/matos Pl.R.407c. c. acc.,
to be in travail with, sumfora=s ba/ros S.Tr.325; th\n kau/xhsin th\n sofistikh/n Epicur.Fr. 93, cf. AP9.578 (Leo Phil.) (where w(=n is in the case of the anteced. by attraction). Causal,
cause to quiver, as in travail, fwnh\ bronth=s w)di/nhse gh=n LXX Si.43.17(18) cod.Alex.

w)di/s (A.Ch.211, Pl.Ep.313a), i=nos, h(: Ep. dat. pl. w)di/nessi h.Ap. 92, Theoc.17.61, etc.: later nom. w)di/n LXXIs.37.3, 1 Ep.Thess.5.3:— mostly in pl.,
pangs or
throes of childbirth, pikra\s w)di=nas e)/xousai Il. 11.271; te/ke . . e)n mo/nais w)di=sin . . didu/mwn sqe/nos ui(w=n at a single
birth, Pi.P.9.85; po/nous e)negkou=s' e)n w)di=si E.Supp.920 (lyr.); e)n w)di/nwn loxi/ais a)na/gkaisi Id.Ba.89 (lyr.), cf. Ion452 (lyr.); ai( di) w)di/nwn gonai/ Id.Ph.355: also in sg., Pi.O.6.43, N.1.36, S.OC533 (lyr.); gunh\ feu/gei pikra\n w)di=na pai/dwn Id.Fr.932. in sg. also,
that which is born amid throes, child, pai=da, filta/thn e)moi\ w)di=na A.Ag.
1418, cf. Pi.O.6.31, E.Ion45; qallo\n i(ero\n e)lai/as, *latou=s w)di=na (fort. w)di=ni） fi/lan Id.IT1102 (lyr.); a)/pteron w)di=na te/knwn, of young birds, Id.HF1040: pl.,
children, AP7.549 (Leon.Alex.); o)rtali/xwn a(palh\ w)di/s, of eggs, Nic.Al.165; tou= w)|ou= e)n w)di=ni o)/ntos Arist.HA560b22; w). *qala/ssas, of Aphrodite, AP9.386; w)di\s meli/sshs, of honey, Nonn.D.5.228, al. metaph.,
travail, anguish, A.Ch.211, Supp.770 (both sg.): also in pl., of love, e)moi\ pikra\s w)di=nas au(tou= prosbalw\n a)poi/xetai S.Tr.42, cf. Pl.R.574a, Phdr.251e: freq. in LXX, Ex.15.14, al., Ev.Matt.24.8.
fruit of the mind's
travail, th=s e)mh=s w). Luc.Dem.Enc.25; lo/gwn w)di=nes Him. Or.18.3; e)pe/wn Tryph.117. w)di=nes qana/tou, a(/|dou, the
bonds of death, LXX 2 Ki.22.6, Ps.17(18).5, 6 (due to confusion of Heb.
[hudot ]ēbel 'pang' with
[hudot ]ěbel 'cord'), cf. Act.Ap.2.24.
w)do/n: ou)do/n, Hsch. (-w=n . . -w=n cod.: Dor. form of o)d[v]o/s; cf. ou)do/s).

w)|dopoio/s, o/n,
making songs or
odes, Theoc.Ep.17.4.

w)|do/s, o( (and in Paus.10.5.12, h(), contr. for a)oido/s,
singer, xrhsmw=n E.Heracl.488, cf. Phld.Mus.p.20 K., etc.; meta\ *le/sbion w)|do/n, prov. of a second-rate musician, Cratin.243, cf. Arist.Fr.545; oi( tou= *dionu/sou w)|. Pl.Lg.812b; xorou/s tinas . . w)|dou/s ib.800e; of cicadae, oi( u(pe kefalh=s w)|. Id.Phdr.262d, cf. AP6.54 (Paul.Sil.); to
 a)lektruo/na to
 w)|do
 a)popni/casa/ mou Pl.Com.14D.; u(po\ to
 w)|do
 o)/rniqa about cockcrow, Poll.1.71.
the cup passed round when a scolion was sung, Antiph.85.2, cf. Tryphoap.Ath.11.503d.

w)du^si/h and w)/du^sis, ews, h(,
anger, wrath, Hsch.; cf. *o)du/ssomai.
w)dw/dei, poet. for o)dw/dei, 3sg. plpf. of o)/zw.
w)|eidh/s, f.l. for w)|oeidh/s, D.S.32.10.
w)/eon, to/, v. w)|o/n.

w)/zw,
cry oh! A.Eu.124, Ar.V.1526 (lyr.). (Fr. w)/, as oi)/zw fr. oi)/.）

w)h/, a cry or call,
holla! A.Eu.94, E.Cyc.51 (lyr.), al., and once in Prose, X.Cyn.6.19.

w)q-e/w, Att. impf. e)w/qoun Ar.Pax637 (troch.), D.9.65, (e)c-) Th. 7.52, etc., and e)w/qei even in h.Merc.305; Ion. and Ep. 3sg. w)/qei Il.21.241; Ion. w)/qeske Od.11.596: but w)/qei E.IT1395 is f.l. for w)qei= (Kirchhoff): fut. w)qh/sw Id.Cyc.592, Ar.Ec.300 (lyr.), (e)c-) S.Aj.1248; but w)/sw E.Med.379, Andr.344, and always in Prose; a)p-w/sw Od.15.280, Ep. inf. a)p-wse/men Il.13.367: Att. aor. e)/wsa Pl.Ti.60c, etc., (e)c-) S.OC1296, 1330, etc.; Ion. and Ep. w)=sa Il.1.220, Hdt.7.167, Ep. w)/saske Od.11.599; but e)/wsa Il.16.410, (a)p-) Od.9.81; later w)/qhsa Ael.NA13.17, etc.: pf. e)/wka （e)c-) Plu.2.48c: plpf. e)w/kei （e)c-) Id.Brut.42:—Med., fut. w)/somai （a)p-) S.El.944, etc., (di-) A.Fr.199.9, etc.:—Att. aor. e)wsa/uhn Th.4.43, Ar.V.1085 (troch., with vv. ll.); Ion. and Ep. w)sa/mhn Il.16.592, Hdt.9.25, v.l. in Ar.V.l.c.:—Pass., fut. w)sqh/somai E.Med.335 (v.l. w)qh/somai), (e)c-) D.24.61: Att. aor. e)w/sqhn （e)c-) X.HG2.4.34, etc.; later w)/sqhn （e)c-) Arr.An.4.25.3, Plot.4.4.45: Att. pf. e)/wsmai X.Cyr.7.1.36, (a)p-, peri-) Th.2.39, 3.57; Ion. part. a)pwsme/nos Hdt.5.69:—
thrust, push, mostly of human force, as of Sisyphus, skhripto/menos xersi/n te posi/n te la=an a)/nw w)/qeske poti\ lo/fon
he kept pushing it . . , Od.11.596, cf. 599; a)po\ ei(=o tra/pezan w)=se podi\ plh/cas 22.20; [e)/gxos] u(pe\k di/froio
pushed it away from . . , Il.5.854; a)\y e)s kouleo\n w)=se ci/fos 1.220; toi=si d' a)p' o)fqalmw=n ne/fos a)xlu/os w)=sen *)aqh/nh 15.668; to\n de' *zeu\s w)=sen o)/pisqe xeiri/ ib.694, cf. 13.193; w)=sai/ [tina] a)f' i(/ppwn 5.19; a)f' i(/ppwn xama=ze ib.835, etc.; so w)=sai e(wuto\n e)s to\ pu=r
rush into the fire, Hdt.7.167; w). tina e)pi\ kefalh/n
throw him headlong down, Pl.R.553b (Pass., w)qe/esqai e)pi\ k. Hdt.7.136); w). tina e)pi\ tra/xhlon Luc.DMort.27.1; petrw=n w)=sai ka/tw E.Cyc. 448, cf. Pl.Phdr.229c; ei)s liqotomi/as D.53.17: freq. of weapons, w). ci/fos di) a)mfote/rwn
thrust it through both, Hdt.3.78; tekou/shs e)s sfaga\s w)=sai ci/fos E.Or.291; dia\ me/sou au)xe/nos w)qei= si/dhron Id.Ph. 1458; fa/sganon di) h(/patos Id.Med.379; ci/fos pro\s h(=par Id.Hel.983; dalou= kw/phn e)/sw blefa/rwn Id.Cyc.485 (anap.), cf. 636; e)k mhrou= do/ru w)=se qu/raze
forced it out from the thigh, Il.5.694; to\ i(ma/tion w)=sai ei)s to\ sto/ma
stuff it into his mouth, Thphr.Char.2.4: th\n qu/ran w)qei=
forces the door, Ar.V.152, cf. Lys.1.24; pu/las E.Or.1562: sts. of other than human force, as of a stream, w)=se de\ nekrou/s Il.21.235, cf. 241; of the wind, *no/tos me/ga ku_ma poti\ . . r(i/on w)qei= Od.3.295; [o( potamo\s] w)qei= ku=ma Metagen.6.3; w). kolo/kuma Ar.Eq.692: metaph., a) d' a)te/ra ta\n a)te/ran ku/lic w)qh/tw Alc.41.
force back in battle, Il.8.336, 13.193, etc.; a)/ndras proti\ a)/stu 16.45; v. infr. 11.
thrust out, banish, w). a(/pantas to\n a)sebh= S.OT1382; e)/cw do/mwn te kai\ pa/tras w)qei=n tina A.Pr.665; a)p' oi)/kwn S.OT241; e)k do/mwn E.Andr.344; e)/cw tina\ fuga/da Pl.R.560d; spondw=n a)/po, a)po\ tw=n i(erw=n, E.Ba.46, Aeschin. 2.86; w). tinas a)qa/ptous S.Aj.1307:—Pass., w)qou/meq' e)/cw Id.Fr.583.7. metaph., w). ta\ prh/gmata
push matters
on, hurry them, Hdt.3.81; e)piqumi/a w)qei= e)pi\ ta\s a)polau/seis Arist.VV1250a24. abs., w)=sa pare/c
pushed off from land, Od.9.488; w)/qei biai/ws E.Tr. 356, cf. X.HG7.4.31; to\ w)qou=n the
motive power, Pl.Cra.401d. Med., mostly in aor.,
thrust or
push away from oneself, force back, esp. in battle, freq. in Il., o)/fra ta/xista w)/sait' *)argei/ous 5.691; tei/xeos a)\y w)/sasqai 12.420; w)/sasqai proti\ *)/ilion, proti\ a)/stu, 8.295, 16.655; th\n i(/ppon w)/santo Hdt.9.25, cf. 3.72, 6.37; w)/sasqai/ tinas kata\ braxu/ Th.4.96; w)same/nwn to\ eu)w/numon ke/ras Id.6.70, etc.; once in Trag., E.IT326: of a horse,
throw its rider, Thgn.260 (s.v.l.). intrans.,
push, press forward, Th.4.11,35, Plu.Ages.32; w)qei=sqai ei)s to\ pro/sqen X.HG7.1.31; pro\s th\n plhgh\n o(mo/se w)qei=sqai Pl.Euthd. 294d; ei)s xei=ras w)qei=sqai toi=s e)nanti/ois Plu.Thes.5. Pass.,
to be thrust, pushed, or
forced, rush or
fall violently, e)pi\ kefalh/n Hdt. (v. supr.1.1); pro\s bi/an E.Hec.406; bia| Id.Med.335, etc.; i(drw=tes taxe/ws w)qou/menoi Hp.Aph.7.85. Med.,
crowd, throng, jostle, X.Cyr.3.3.64; w). w(/sper u(/es Theoc.15.73, cf. Arist.HA572b25: impers. in Pass., e)pi\ me/zon w)qei=tai
the crush gets worse, Herod.4.54.
w)/q-hsis, ews, h(, = w)qismo/s, Alex.Aphr.Pr.1.90.
w)qiaka\ xrw/mata, dub. sens. in Zos.Alch.p.245B. (fort. w)oqutika/).

w)q-i/zw, = w)qe/w,
thrust, push, or
push on, Them.Or.24.304a. Med.,
push against one another, jostle, struggle, Luc.Pisc.42; ei)s th\n proedri/an, pro\s to\ a)du/naton, Aristid.2.95J., 1.388 J.: metaph.,
wrangle, Hdt.3.76.

w)q-ismo/s, o(,
thrusting, pushing, a)spi/dwn of shield against shield, Th.4.96.
jostling, struggling, of combatants in a mêlée, *perse/wn te kai\ *lakedaimoni/wn w). e)ge/neto pollo/s Hdt.7.225; a)pike/sqai e)s w). to come to
close quarters, Id.9.62; w). a)mfi\ ta\ qu/retra X.An.5.2.17; o( peri' ta\s pu/las w). kai\ pnigmo/s Plb.4.58.9, cf. Anaxandr.33.7: metaph., w). lo/gwn
dispute, altercation, Hdt.8.78, 9.26.
w)i/a or w)/ia, h(, v. w)/|a.
w)i/+das: ta\s mh_m . . oi)ki/das, Hsch.: also w)i/+das: ou)do/s, Id. (leg. w)do/s, Dor. for o)d[v]o/s, ou)do/s).
w)i/+eto, v. oi)/omai.

w)i/+zw, (w)/ion, w)|o/n)
to sit on eggs, brood, Id. (Fort. w)/izw [i. e. w)/|zw], cf. e)pw/|zw.）
w)/i+cen, v. oi)/gnumi.
w)/ion, to/, v. w)|o/n.
w)/i+sxa: u(ph/nema, and w)hri/xqai: u(ph/nemoi, w(/rimoi, Id.

w)=ka, poet. Adv. of w)ku/s,
quickly, swiftly, Il.1.402, 5.88, Od.6.317, etc.; strengthd., ma/l' w)=. Il.2.52, Od.2.8, etc.; w)=. ma/l' Il.17.190, al. of Time, w)=. d' e)/peita
immediately, Od.17.329, Il.18.527, al.:—Cleitorian (Arc.) word acc. to AB1096.

*)wkea/n-eios [a^], on,
of Ocean, Gal.19.189, Porph.Chr.69, Sch. rec. A.Pr.300, Sch.E.Hipp.121, etc. (sts. incorrectly written w)kea/nios).
*)wkean-hi+a/s, a/dos, h(, Ep. fem. of *)wkea/neios, Nonn.D.32.53.

*)wkea/n-hs, ou, o(, an old name of
the Nile, acc. to D.S.1.19; in 1.12 interpreted trofh\ mh/thr.

*)wkean-i/nh [i_], h(,
daughter of Ocean, Ocean nymph, Hes. Th.364,389, etc.
*)wkean-i/s, i/dos, h(, = w)keani=tis 11, au)=rai Pi.O.2.71; nh=sos Phld.Rh.1.179S. pl., *)w. *nu/mfai Ocean nymphs, Call. Fr.24a, Arg.A.Pr.

*)wkean-i=tis, idos, h(,
daughter of Ocean, Virg.G.4.341. Adj.
of, in, from the Ocean, *qou/lh AP4.3b.8 (Agath.); w). qa/lassa, = w)keano/s 11, D.H.1.3. h( *)wk. (sc. gh=) the
shore of Ocean, Str.1.2.28.

*)wkea^no/bru^tos, on,
copious as ocean, glw=ssa Olymp.Alch. p.83B.

*)wkea^no/nde, Adv.
to Ocean, h.Merc.68, h.Hom.31.16.

*)wkea^no/s, ou=, o(,
Oceanus, son of Uranus and Gaia, Hes.Th. 133: wedded to Tethys, father of Thetis, Il.14.302, 18.399; and of all the Oceanids, Hes.Th.337 sqq., A.Pr.140 (anap.); god of the primeval water, and source of all smaller waters, Il.21.195 sqq., Hes.Th.368; *)wkeano
 qew=n ge/nesin Il.14.201; potamoi=o r(e/eqra *)wkeanou=, o(/sper ge/nesis pa/ntessi te/tuktai ib.246; conceived as a
great River which compasses the earth's disc, returning into itself, a)yo/rroos Il.18.399, Od.20.65; represented as encircling the shield of Achilles, Il.18.607, cf. Hes.Sc.314; *)wkea/nw ga=s t' a)pu\ perra/twn Alc.84; *)w. a)kalarrei/ths, baqu/rroos, baqurrei/ths, Il.7.422, 21.195; r(o/os *)wkeanoi=s, r(oai\ *)w., 16.151, 3.5 (so *)w., pagai/ Pi.Fr.30.2; *)/inaxena=tor, pai= tou= krhnw=n patro\s *)wkeanou= S.Fr.270 (anap.)); criticized by Hdt. ou)/ tina e)/gwge oi)=da potamo
 *)w. e)o/nta 2.23, cf. 4.8, Str.1.1.7: but *)wkeano\s o(
 tauro/kranos a)gka/lais e(li/sswn kukloi= xqo/na E.Or.1377 (lyr.). later the name of
the great Outward Sea, opp. to the Inward or Mediterranean (qa/lassa, po/ntos), Hdt. Il.cc., Pi.P.4.26, 251; th
 *eu)rw/phn kai\ th
 *)asi/an kai\ th
 *libu/hn nh/sous ei)=nai a(\s perirrei=n ku/klw| to
 *)wkeano/n Theopomp.Hist.Fr.74（
a), cf. Arist.Mu.393a17; *)w. o( bo/reios, o( e(spe/rios, o( kata\ meshmbri/an, Plu.Mar.11, Ant.61, D.S.17.96; *prettaniko/s, *germaniko/s, *kanta/brios, etc., Ptol.Geog.2.3.3, 2.3.4, 2.6.3, al. metaph., w). xrhma/twn
oceans of wealth, Lyd. Mag.3.62 (pl.); pragma/twn ib.2.7. w)keane/
bravo! in acclamations, POxy.41.4 (iii/iv A. D., wkaianai and wkaanai Pap.: an exaggeration of *nei=los similarly used, Jo.Chrys. peri\ kenodoci/as cap.8 Schulte). Pythag. name for 9, Theol.Ar.57.
w)kh/eis, essa, en, later poet. form of w)ku/s, te/retra AP6.205 (Leon.).
w)ki/minos [i^m], h, on, made of w)/kimon, Dsc.1.49.

w)ki^moeidh/s, e/s,
like w)/kimon, neut. as Adv., w)kimoeide\s o)/dwde Nic. Al.280. w)kimoeide/s, to/,
catchfly, Silene gallica, Dsc.4.28, Gal.12.158. = xamaile/wn me/las, Dsc.3.9. = klinopo/dion, ib.95. = e)/rinos,
Campanula Erinos, small rampion, Ps.-Dsc.4.141.

w)/ki^m-on, to/,
basil, Ocimum Basilicum, Stratt.66.5 (lyr., pl.), Eub.54, Thphr.HP1.6.6, al., Dsc.2.141, Gal.6.640, etc.

w)ki^m-w/dhs, es, = w)kimoeidh/s 1,
like basil, fu/llon Thphr.HP7.7.2.

w)/ki^non, to/, a fodder-plant, perhaps
clover ( = w)ku/qoos 11), Lat.
ocinum, Cato RR27,33 (cf. Plin.HN17.198), Varro RR1.31.

w)ki/s, i/dos, h(, = e)nw/tion,
ear-ring, Hsch.
w)/kistos, old Sup. of w)ku/s (q. v.).

w)ku/-a^los [u^], on, perh.
sea-swift, speeding o'er the sea, epith. of a ship, Il.15.705, Od.12.182, 15.473, S.Aj.710 (lyr.), Mosch.2.60. later, generally,
swift, violent, r(iph/ Opp.H.2.535, cf. Pi.Parth.2.19. (It is doubtful whether -alos comes from a(/ls; see opinions of D.H. and Hdn.Gr. ap. Sch.Il. l.c.)
w)ku-bo/ai: taxuma/xai, Hsch.; but w)=ka boa=s a)koa\n meqe/pwn is correct in AP15.27 (Simm.Ov.).

w)ku-bo/los, on,
quick-shooting, quick-striking, to/ca S.Ph.710 (lyr.); i)oi/ AP6.118 (Antip.); xei=res APl.4.195 (Satyr.); of the melana/etos, Arist. HA618b29.

w)ku-ge/neqlos, on,
quickly born or
gendered, ei)s to/kon
w)kuge/neqlon Jo.Gaz.Ecphr.2.59.

w)ku-dh/ktwr, oros, o(,
sharp-biting, r(i/nh AP6.92 (Phil.).

w)ku-di/daktos [i^], on,
quickiy taught, oi)wno/s ib. 9.562 (Crin.).

w)ku-di/nhtos [i_], Dor. w)ku/-a_tos, on,
quick-whirling, a(/millai Pi.I.5(4).6.
w)kudro/m-as, ou, o(, = w)ku/dromos, Epigr. ap. Paus.6.13.10.

w)kudrom-e/w,
run swiftly, Ph.1.560; pro\s a)reth/n ib.459.

w)ku/drom-os, on,
swift-running, a)/ellai E.Ba.872 (lyr.); sku/lakes Arion 1.8; [*)erinu/es] w). w(/ste no/hma Orph.H.69.9; ne/wn w). h(/bh Historia 6.595 (Gortyn, ii B. C.): Sup. -w/tatos Ph.1.143, 648, al.: Comp. -w/tera 1.569.

w)ku^-eph/s, e/s,
quick-speaking, of Apollo, AP9.525.25.

w)ku^/-qoos, a, on,
swift-running, *nu/mfai E.Supp.993 (dub. l., lyr.).
quickgrowing, tripe/thlon Call.Dian.165; = tri/fullos,
clover, Hsch.

w)ku^-ke/leuqos, on,
completing life's journey quickly, Supp.Epigr.7.329 (Caesarea Philippi).

w)ku^-lo/xeia, h(,
giving a quick birth, of Artemis, Orph. H.2.4, 36.8; of *fu/sis, ib.10.19.

w)ku^-ma/xos [a^], on,
quick to fight, AP6.132 (Nossis).
w)ku^/-moiros, on, = w)ku/moros, Epigr.Gr.246.1 (Bithynia).

w)ku^/-molos, on,
quick-going, Suid.

w)ku^/-moros, on,
quickly dying, dying early, of Achilles, Il.1.417, 18.95, 458; w)kumorw/tatos a)/llwn 1.505; of the suitors, Od.1.266, al.; of fitro/s of Meleager, B.5.141; in Epitaphs, Epigr.Gr.527 (Beroea), 540 (Thrace), al.; so in later Prose, Ph.2.45; of flowers, Philostr.Ep.4: of things,
transient, J.AJ11.3.6, Ph.1.478: neut. pl. as Adv., Supp.Epigr.6.501 (Isaura). Act.,
bringing a quick or
early death, i)oi/ Il.15.441, Od.22.75; farma/kwn duna/meis Plu.Ant.71; kw/neion -w/taton Id.Dio58.

w)ku^/-noos, on,
quickly marking, Opp.C.1.37.
w)ku/nw, = taxu/nw, o)cu/nw, Hsch.

w)ku^=pe/di_los, on,
with swift sandals, swift-footed, Nonn.D.8.220.

w)ku^-pe/ths, ou, o(,
swift-flying, swift-running, i(/ppw w)kupe/ta Il.8.42, 13.24; i)/rhc Hes.Op.212: metaph., w). mo/ros S.Tr.1042 (lyr.):—also fem. *)wkupe/th, name of a Harpy, Hes.Th.267; and w)kupe/teia xelidw/n, of a fish (cf. xelidw/n 11), Marc.Sid.17.

w)ku^/-pla^nos, on,
quick-wandering, w). pteru/gwn r(ipai=s E.Fr.594.4 (anap., = Critias 18.4 D.).

w)ku^/-ploos, on,
quick-sailing, Hsch. s.v. o( w)ku/kloos, Suid.
w)ku^-po/dhs, ou, o(, poet. for w)ku/pous, dro/mos AP5.222 (Maced.); lagwo/s 9.371: in Dor. form, -w)kupo/das *)/adrastos E.Hyps.Fr.1 ii 34 (lyr.).

w)ku^/-poinos, on,
quickly avenged, parbasi/a A.Th.743 (lyr.).

w)ku^/-pompos, on,
conveying rapidly, of ships, do/ru B.16.90; nau=s E.IT1137 (lyr.); pla/tai ib.1427.

w)ku^-pore/w,
move quickly, Str.8.3.29; of a ship, Epigr.Gr.981.10 (Philae).

w)ku^/-poros, on,
quick-going, in Hom. always epith. of ships, Il.1.421, 488, al., cf. Choeril.6; of streams,
swift-flowing, po/rqmeum' a)xe/wn A.Ag.1557 (anap.); kuma/twn r(ipai/ Pi.P.4.194: later, o)i+stoi/ AP5.85 (Claudian.); of a person, w)ku/poros metani/ssetai E.Hyps.Fr.1 iii 37 (lyr.).
w)/ku^-pos (parox.), on, poet. form of sq., of Apollo, AP9.525.25.

w)ku^/-pous, o(, h(, poun, to/: acc. masc. w)ku/poun E.Hel.243 (lyr.): Ep. dat. pl. -po/dessi Il.2.383, etc.:—
swift-footed, in Hom. always epith. of horses, Il. l. c., al., and so in Pi.Parth.2.44; of the hare, Hes.Sc.302; e)/lafoi S.OC1093 (lyr.); i(ppikw=n . . w)ku/pous a)gw/n Id.El.699; ku/nes E.Hipp.1129 (lyr.); of Hermes, Id.Hel. l.c.

w)ku^/-pteros, on,
swift-winged, i)/rhc Il.13.62: metaph. of ships (ptera/ being
the sails), A.Supp.734. w)ku/ptera, ta/,
the long quill-feathers in a wing, Ar.Av.803, Stratt.27, A.R.2.1255, Babr.99(100).4, Plu.CG1.
w)ku^-re/eqros, on, = w)ku/roos, Nonn.D.26.362.
w)ku^-ro/hs, Dor. w)ku^-ro/as, o(, = sq., E.Ba.568 (lyr.), AP9.219 (Diod.Sard.), A.R.2.349, 650.

w)ku^/-roos, on, poet. Adj.
swift-flowing, potamo/s Il.5.598, 7.133:—fem. *)wku^ro/h, h(, an Oceanid, h.Cer. 420, Hes.Th.360.

w)ku/s [u^], w)kei=a, w)ku/, gen. e/os, ei/as, e/os: Ep. and Ion. fem. w)ke/a^, as always in Il.,2.786, al. (in the formula w)ke/a *)=iris), cf. Hes.Th. 780; in Od., only in 12.374 (v.l. w)ku/s): fem. pl. w)kei=ai Od.7.36; Ep. gen. w)keia/wn 9.101, Il.4.500, etc.; fem. w)ku/s Jo.Gaz.Ecphr.1.240, v.l. (e)n polloi=s Sch.) in Od.12.374:—
quick, swift, fleet, kixa/nei toi bradu\s w)ku/n Od.8.329; mostly of persons, freq. with po/das added, specially of Achilles, Il.1.58, etc.; also w)ku\s *)ax., without po/das, 21.211, 22.188; so w)ke/a, of Iris, 2.786, al. (w)=ka de\ *)=i. shd. be read for w)ke/a d' *)=iris, 23.198); of animals, [i)/rhc] w)/kistos petehnw=n 15.238, cf. 21.253; i(/ppoi 8.88; e)/lafoi Od.6.104; also of things, esp. of ships, Il.8.197, Od.7.36; of arrows, Il.5.106, 112, al.; w). pte/ruc Pi.P.1.6; ai)eto/s Id.N.3.80; i)/t' a)=sson w)kei=s S.Ant.1215, cf. E.Ba. 452, etc.; w)ku\s *)/arhs Id.Andr.106 (eleg.), cf. Od.8.331 (Sup.); of the sun, w). h)e/lios Mimn.11.5, AP7.466 (Leon.): also w)ku\ no/hma h.Merc.43, cf. Od.7.36; qnatw=n fre/nes w)ku/terai Pi.P.4.139; pra=cis, ga/mos, ib.9.67,114 (Sup.); w)kei=ai xa/rites glukerw/terai AP10.30: to\ w)ku/
quickness, sharpness, E.Fr.1032; w)/kistos th=| a)koh=| Ael.NA6.63. of sound,
shrill, a)oidai/, of the creaking of door-hinges, A.R.4.42. Adv. -e/ws Pi.P.3.58, N.10.64, Parth.2.6, Luc.Salt.19; cf. w)=ka: once neut. w)ku/ as Adv., w(\s e)/pes' *(/ektoros w)ku\ xamai\ me/nos Il.14.418 (v.l. w)=ka, v. Sch.). degrees of Comparison, regul. Sup. w)ku/tatos Od.8.331, Pi.P.9.114: irreg. Sup., w)/kistos petehnw=n Il. 15.238, 21.253; w)/kistos o)/leqros 22.325; [kairo/s] A.Th.65. Adv. w)/kista Od.22.77, 133, A.R.4.242.—The word is mostly Ep., being used once by A. and once by S., but more freq. in E.; also in late Prose, as Aret.SA2.3 (Comp.), Ael. l.c., Luc.Herm.77.
w)ku/shmon (-simon cod.): taxe/ws fanero/n, Hsch.

w)ku/-skopos, on,
quick-aiming, of Apollo, AP9.525.25.

w)ku/-stolos, on,
journeying swiftly, JRS16.90 No.222 (Phrygia).

w)ku/ths, htos, Dor. w)/ku-tas, h(,
swiftness, fleetness, Pi.P.11.50, E.Ba.1090, Pl.Ax.364c, Arr.An.1.1.13, Hippodam. ap. Stob.4.39.26; w). yuxh=s Onos.1.7.
w)ku^-tokeu/s, v. sub w)kuto/kon fin.

w)ku^-toki/a, h(,
speedy delivery, cj. for o)cutoki/a in Rhetor. in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).133.

w)ku^-to/kios, on,
promoting a quick birth, Dsc.4.14, 5.154: li/qos Cyran.46. w)kuto/kion (sc. fa/rmakon), to/,
a medicine for this purpose, Hp.Mul.1.77, Steril.224, Ar.Th.504, Thphr.HP9.9.3, Berl.Sitzb.1934.1046 (pl.):— in Ar. the Rav. Ms. gives w)kuto/kei); to\ w)kuto/keion proparocu/netai Hdn.Gr.1.376; w)kuto/keion, e_i_ di/fqoggos: kai\ ga\r
w)kutokeu/s, Choerob. in An.Ox.2.280; w)kuto/kia is cited from Ar. by Poll.2.7, cf. 4.208.

w)ku^-to/kos, on,
causing quick and easy birth, selh/nh (i. e. Artemis), Tim.Fr.28. of a river, w). pedi/wn e)pini/setai
giving quick increase, S.OC689 (lyr.). w)ku/tokon, to/,
quick birth, easy delivery, Hdt.4.35.

w)ku^-fo/nos, on,
quickly fatal, of diseases, prob. in Aret.SA2.3.
w)=lac, akos, h(, Dor. for au)=lac, EM625.37.

w)lekra_n-i/zw,
thrust with the elbow, Com.Adesp.1093 ap.Poll.2.140: but o)lekrani/zesqai Phryn.PSp.97 B.; cf. sq.

w)le/kra_n-on, to/, for w)leno/kranon, = w)le/nhs krani/on (*)aristofa/nhs o)le/krana le/gei ta\ tw=n w)lenw=n krani/a Suid.s.v. o)le/kranon,)
point of the elbow, Arist.HA493b27 (v.l. o)le/kranon), al.; Hp. used a)gkw/n for w)le/kranon, acc. to Gal. UP2.2,14: but o)le/kr. is found in Hp.Epid.7.61. [o)le/kranon is required by the metre in Ar.Pax443; to\ w)le/kranon dia\ tou= w_ profe/rousin, h( de\ sunh/qeia dia\ tou= o_ Hellad. ap. Phot.p.533 B.; Phot. has w)l-, but places it after o)le/kei.]

w)le/n-h, h(,
elbow, or rather
the arm from the elbow downwards (cf. w)=mos 1.1), h.Merc.388, A.Pr.60, S.Tr.926, etc.; peri/ball' w)le/nas Ar.Ra.1322 (lyr.): freq. in E., w)le/nais, e)n w)le/naisin fe/rein, HF 1381, Ba.1238; metai/rein e)n w)le/nais IT1158; w)le/nais labei=n Ba. 1125 codd.; a)p' w)le/nhs balei=n Ph.1375; fi/lhn o)re/cet' w)le/nhn; Med.902; peri\ w)le/nas de/ra| balei=n Ph.165 (lyr., cf. 307, 311); ei)s w)le/nas tino\s dou=nai/ ti Tr.1142; w). a)/krai the hands, IT283; i)/sas de/ moi yh/fous dihri/qmhse *palla\s w)le/nh| is dub. l. ib.966: in later Prose, Luc.
D Deor.20.10, al. (of the
wing-bone of a bird, Id.Icar.3): Cleitorian (Arc.) word acc. to AB1096. stefa/nai is glossed by ai( tw=n bwmw=n w)le/nai, Hsch.
mat, mattress, gloss on Lat.
torus (which has these and other senses), Gloss.: cf. w)lh/n, w)lenostro/fos. (Lat.
ulna, OHG.
elina, OE.
eln, el-bogi, 'ell, elbow'; Goth.
aleina; also Skt.
aratni/s, OSlav.
lak[ucaron]t[icaron], Lith.
uolektìs (all =
elbow and
ell); cf. w)llo/n and a)/lac.）

w)le/n-ios, a, on,
in the elbow or
arm, ai)\c w). the star Capella
in the elbow of Auriga, Arat.164, v. Sch.; misinterpreted as *)wle/nios (cf. *)/wlenos), Str.8.7.5. v. *)/wlenos.

w)len-i/s, i/dos, h(,
mat or
bundle, Poll.10.170.

w)len-i/ths [i_], ou, o(,
of the arm, Lyc. 155.

*)/wlenos, h(,
Olenos, a city of Achaia, Il.2.639: prob. named from its lying
in the bend (w)le/nh) of a hill, hence Adj. *)wle/nios, a, on,
Achaean, AP7.723.

w)lenostro/fos, o(,
mat-maker, PPetr.3p.173 (iii B. C.), BGU1528 (iii B. C.);
toranus (leg.
torarius) = wlenos: trofos, Gloss.: cf. w)le/nh 3 and w)lh/n.

w)lesi/-bwlos [i^], on,
clod-crushing, sfu=ra AP6.104 (Phil.), 297 (Phanias).

w)lesi/-karpos, on,
losing its fruit, i)te/ai w)., because they shed their fruits before ripening, Od.10.510, cf. Thphr.HP3.1.3; [e)rineo/s] Id.CP2.9.14: metaph., w). tu/mpanon the kettledrum in the mysteries of Cybele,
because the priests who beat it were eunuchs, Opp.C.3.283: dub. sens. in Cerc.6.14.

w)lesi/-oikos, on,
destroying the house, ta\n w). qeo/n (sc. *)erinu/n) A.Th.720 (lyr.); a)na/stasin w)lesi/oikon Orph.Fr.285.26; a(rpagai\ w). ib.58; written o)les- in Lib. Decl.26.32 codd.
squandering one's substance, Com.Adesp. 1200.

w)lesi/-teknos, on,
child-murdering, Nonn.D.44.91.

w)lh/n, e/nos, o(, collat. form of w)le/nh, = braxi/wn, Suid. s.vv. w)le/nh (where gen. w)lh=nos) and w)lh/n: esp. in sense
mat (cf. w)le/nh 3), e)a\n e)k th=s kala/mhs w)le/nas poih/sas ku/klw| peri\ tou\s sirou\s peritei/nh|s au)tou/s Ph.Bel.88.4 (cf. o)/linoi: kriqh=s desmoi/, Hsch.): w)le/nwn dorwsi/mwn mentioned in brick-building accounts, PPetr.3p.139 (iii. B.C.); also fem., ta\s w)le/nas tou= e)laiourgi/ou dipla=s poi/hson PFay.110.29 (i A. D.), cf. Jahresh.26 Beibl.54 (Ephes., i A. D., o)le/nas lapis): they were straw mats used to bind together layers of bricks, kalami/das ta\s nu=n legome/nas w)le/nas, e)pei\ a)po\ kala/mwn gi/nontai, h)\ tou\s qhlukou\s kala/mous tou\s pro\s su/ndesmon tw=n plinqi/nwn katastrwma/twn th=s oi)kodomi/as (AB 269, cf. EM485.30): w)le/nes in pl. =
matting for a roof, Hsch. s.v. ko/nuza (w)le/nwn cod., rightly).

w)/lhs, es,
destroyed, w)/lh kai\ panw/lh ge/noito au)tou= to\ ge/nos te kai\ au)to/s Ath.Mitt.15.154 (Iasos); w)/lh panw/lh ge/noito Keil-Premerstein,
Zweiter Bericht No.157 (near Thyatira, ii A. D.); mhde\ gh= karpoforh/soito au)tw=| . . a)lla\ w)lhpanw/lh (sic) BMus.Inscr.918.5 (Halic., ii or iii A. D.).

w)li/ggh, h(, variously expld. in EM821.43, AB318, = a)kariai=on, e)la/xiston. Att. for
doze (e)pi\ tou= nusta/cai).
wrinkles beside the eyes, 'crow's feet'; this last sense is given by Poll. 2.67 (where vv. Il. ou)/liggas, w)li/gkas, e)/liggas, w)/riggas) as found in poets, and the remark th
 de\ w)li/gghn (v.l. w)ll-） dhlou=n kai\ pnoh
 kai\ skia
 kai\ a)kare\s pneu=ma (EM and AB Il. cc.) may refer to the same poet. passage. Hsch. cites w)liggi/a in all three senses, also w)liggia/w, = nusta/zw, and w)liggh/i+os, a, on, = o)li/gos.
w)li/ggion, glossed by o)li/gon, EM821.46, AB318.
w)li/sqhsa, w)/lisqon, v. o)lisqa/nw.
w(li^th/meros, on, in Hsch., Ion. crasis for o( a)lith/meros.

w)lka, w)=lkas, only in acc. sg. and pl., = a)/loc, au)=lac,
furrow, Il. 13.707, Od.18.375, Mosch.2.81, A.R.3.1054, 1333. (kata\ w)=lka Il. l. c. has perh. replaced kat' *a)/volka which may have been an old Aeol. form (a)vḷka).)
w(=lloi, Ion. crasis for oi( a)/lloi, Hdt.1.48: read by Zenod. in Il.2.1.
w)llo/n: th\n tou= braxi/onos kamph/n, ktl., Hsch. w)lugi/wn: skoteinw=n, kakw=n, makrw=n, o)ce/wn, mega/lwn, Id.

w)ma/dios [a^], o(, (w)mo/s) as epith. of Dionysus, = w)mhsth/s, because he had
human sacrifices at Chios and Tenedos, Orph.H.30.5, Euelp. ap.Porph.Abst.2.55; w). xoroi/ dances in his honour, IG14.2138.
raw, kre/a Epic. in Arch.Pap.7p.4. (w)=mos)
passing over the shoulder, nebri/s, telamw/n, Nonn.D.1.34, 13.308, cf. Hsch.

w)ma^di/s, w)ma^do/n, Adv.
on the shoulder, on the shoulders, Hsch.

w)malgi/a, h(,
pain in the shoulder, Orib.Fr.70 (pl.).

w)malqh/s, e/s, (w)mo/s, a)lqai/nw） e(/lkos w). a wound
scarred over too soon, without healing properly, Hsch.

w(ma^li/a, h(,
flat rate, average, e)gdi/domen . . ta\s me\n sth/las . . pro\s li/qon e)f' w(mali/an o(/ ti a)\n eu(/rwsin IG7.3073.7 (Lebad., ii B. C.); suntele/sei dia/xwma mh=kos e)f' w(mali/an e_, pla/tos ka/tw c_ a)/nw m_, w(/st' ei)=nai e)f' w(mali/an n_ PPetr.3p.125 (iii B. C.). (Formed fr. a)n-wmali/a, cf. o(malo/s.）

w)mampe/li^nos, h, on,
of the colour of the fresh vine-leaf, opp. chrampe/linos, Peripl.M.Rubr.65.

w)maxqh/s, e/s,
heavy to the shoulders, ph/rh AP6.104 (Phil.).
w)=mbroi, = w)= ponhroi/, Hsch. (w)/mbrei cod.).
w)mh/leton: e)rhrigme/non, Hsch.: cf. sq.

w)mh/lu^sis, ews, h(,
bruised meal of raw corn, esp. barley or wheat (hence with kriqi/nh or puri/nh added), used for poultices, Hp.Morb. 2.31, Nat.Mul.27, Gal.10.282, 19.156; applied without water, Id.12.863; written divisim, meta\ w)mh=s lu/sews Dsc.3.24, Arching. ap. Gal.12.675, Gp.14.7.7. (Compd. of w)mo/s and *a)/lu^sis 'grinding', cf. a)/lesis, a)le/w, a)/leuron, and foreg.; also perh. OE.
ealu 'ale':—the form w)mh=s lu/sews by popular etymology: ei)rh=sqai de\ o(/ti ou) frugo/menon a)lh/qetai AB318.)
w)mhs-th/r, h=ros, o(, = sq., Opp.H.5.324.

w)mhs-th/s, ou=, Dor. w)mhs-ta/s, o(, (w)mo/s, e)/dw)
eating raw flesh, oi)wnoi/ Il.11.454; ku/nes 22.67, S.Ant.697; i)xqu/es Il.24.82; *ke/rberos Hes.Th.311; le/wn B.12.46, Orac. ap. Hdt. 5.92.b/, A.Ag.827 (as a noun, of a lion, AP6.237 (Antist.)); ai)eto/s A.R.2.1259; o)/fis (sc. *)/exidna） w)mhsth/s Hes.Th.300; epith. of Dionysus, = w)ma/dios 1, AP9.524.25, cf. Plu.2.462b (of a)/kratos). Adv. -ti/ Zonar.
savage, brutal, w). kai\ a)/pistos a)nh/r Il.24.207, cf. Plu. Ant.24. (Aristarch. pronounced it w)mhstai/ like a)qlhtai/; Tyrannio w)mh=stai like komh=tai, Sch.Il.22.67.)

w)mi/a, h(, (w)=mos)
shoulder, i.e. (apptly.)
angle, of a building, LXX 3 Ki.6.13(8), 7.17(30), al., cf. PVat.11rv16(ii A. D.).

w)miai/a fle/y, the
humero-cephalic vein, Gal.18(1).386, al. neut. pl. w)miai=a, neu=ra
shoulder-muscles, Arist.HA515b10, cf. Hld. 10.27.

w)mi/as, ou, o(,
a broad-shouldered person, Poll.3.149, Hsch.

w)mi/a_sis, ews, h(,
shouldering, an allegorization of the name Shechem, Ph.1.92,471.
w)mi/dios, a, on, cited as radical of e)pwmi/dios, Theognost.Can.54.

w)mi/zomai, Med.,
take on one's shoulders, Suid. (v.l. w)mhsa/menos), Zonar.

w)/milla, h(,
a game in which nuts, etc., were thrown into a ring (ei)s w)/millan Poll.9.102): hence metaph. of a
party, circle, ei)s w)/. a)risth/somen Eup.250; ei)/seim' ei)s w)/. Id.288.
w)/mion, Dim. of w)=mos, AP11.157 (Ammian.); dub. l. in LXX Jb.18.13.

w)misth/s, ou=, o(, (w)mi/zomai)
porter, Hdn.Epim.100 (w)misqh/s）

w)mo-bo/eios, a, on, Ion. w)mo-bo/eos, or w)mo-bo/i+nos,
of raw, untanned ox-hide, a)spi/das w)moboi/+nas Hdt.7.76,79; ge/rra daseiw=n bow=n w)mobo/eia (v.l. -bo/i+na) X.An.4.7.22; derma/twn w)moboei/wn (v.l. boi/+nwn) ib.26; sa/lpigcin w)moboi/+nais ib.7.3.32 codd.:—h( w)moboe/h (sc. dora/),
a raw ox-hide (cf. leonte/h, etc.), Hdt.3.9, 4.65: in later writers usu. in form w)mo-bo/i+nos, Str.15.1.42, D.S.3.8, etc.: acc. pl. w)moboei=s in AP6.21.4 is formed by a false analogy, as if fr. w)moboeu/s. w)moboei/ou moi paraqei\s to/mon . . , kai\ tri/a moi kera/sas w)moboeio/tera . . having set before me a slice
of raw beef, and mixed me three cups
yet more raw than beef, AP11.137 (Lucill.).

w)mo-bo/i+os, on,
made from untanned ox-hide, ko/llan w)mobo/i+on Supp.Epigr.3.147 (Eleusis, iii B. C.).
w)mo-boreu/s, e/ws, o(, = sq., Nic.Th.739.
w)mo-bo/ros, on, = sq., A.R.1.636, Ael.NA15.11, Ph.1.670; ble/pein w)mobo/ron v.l. in Alciphr.3.21.

w)mo-brw/s, w=tos, o(, h(,
eating raw flesh, E.Tr. 436, HF889 (lyr.), Tim.Pers.150, prob. in S.Fr.799.5.

w)mo/-brwtos, on,
eaten raw, Nic.Al.428.

w)mo-bu/rsi^nos, h, on,
made of raw leather, a)spi/des Str.16.4.17; sa/kh Sch.DIl.5.453: (hence corrupted w)mo-bu/rsia, ta/, EM558.42, Zonar. s.v. law/h/i+a):—also w)mo/-bursos, on, qw/rakes Plu. Crass.25.

w)mo-ge/rwn, ontos, o(, h(,
a fresh, active old man, Il.23.791, Megasth. ap. Arr.Ind.9.7 (pl.), AP7.363.9, Gal.6.379, cf. Hsch.
one untimely old, as expl. of the Ep. w)mo\n gh=ras (v. w)mo/s 11.3), EM821.48: so as Adj., bo/struxos w). AP5.263 (Paul.Sil.).
w)mo/-graus, h(, fem. of foreg., Men.979.

w)mo-da^kh/s, e/s,
fiercely gnawing, i(/meros A.Th. 692 (lyr.).

*)wmo/da^mos, o(,
Fierce Conqueror, alleg. name of a demon, Hom. Epigr.14.10.

w)mo-de/yhtos, on,
raw-tanned, Suid. s.v. *semi/ramis.

w)mo/-dropos, on,
plucked unripe, no/mima w)., prop. the right
of plucking the fresh fruit, metaph. for the rights
of the marriage-bed, the
husband's rights, A.Th.333(lyr.).

w)mo-qete/w, in sacrificing,
place the raw pieces duly on the altar, Il.1.461, 2.424, Od.3.458:—Med., w)moqetei=to, pa/ntwn a)rxo/menos mele/wn, e)s pi/ona dhmo/n 14.427: later, gerlerally,
sacrifice, a)rneio/n A.R.3.1033 (Act.). (Fr. w)mo/s,
raw. Eust., however, says (134.35) that some derived it fr. w)=mos
shoulder, and expld. it accordingly.)

w)/mo-qric, tri^xos, o(, h(,
fierce-crested, xe/ludros (of Antenor) Lyc. 340.

w)mo/-qu_mos, on,
savage-hearted, S.Aj.885 (lyr.), Ph.2.15, al.
w)/moi, v. w)=.

w)m-oi/dhs, ou, o(, (oi)de/w)
with swollen or
high shoulders, Eust.1684.28.

w)mo-kotu/lh [u^], h(,
shoulder-joint, Poll.2.137.

w)mo-kra^th/s, e/s,
of rude untamed might, of Ajax, S.Aj.205 (anap.); also expld. as
strong-shouldered, v. Sch. ad loc.

w)mo-ku_dia/w,
to be proud of broad shoulders, Com.Adesp.1201.

w)mo/-li^non, to/,
raw flax, A.Fr.206; used for
lint, Hp.Morb.2.60, Int.23, al.; gloss on sxi/dia, Hsch. (pl.).
coarse linen towel or
napkin, Cratin.9(lyr., pl.), Plu. 2.509a.

w)mo/-li^nos, on,
made of raw flax, Hp.Mul.2.157.

w(mologhme/nws, Adv. part. pf. Pass. of o(mologe/w,
confessedly, without contradiction, D.S.15.10, Poll.6.208, Phalar.Ep.119.3; cf. o(mologoume/nws.

w)mopla/th [a^], h(, (w)=mos)
shoulder blade, freq. in pl. w)mopla/tai Arist.HA493b12, al: sg.in Hp.Art.1, Diog.Apoll.6; also of animals, as of the horse, X.Eq.1.7; of the dog, hare, boar, Id.Cyn.4.1, 5.10: sg., ib.10.16, Eq.6.2, Arist.HA498a33, 512a28, PA693b1, SIG1017.8 (Sinope, iii B. C.); su\n w)mopla/ta| me/gan w)=mon Theoc.26.22.
w)morgh/s, e/s, = sklhro\s kai\ xalepo/s, EM822.12, AB318: also w)morgo/s, o/n, ibid., cf. Hsch.

w)=mos, o(: (v. sub fin.):—
the shoulder with the upper arm (w)le/nh being
the lower), ci/fei+ klhi+=da par' w)=mon plh=c', a)po\ d' au)xe/nos w)=mon e)e/rgaqen h)d' a)po\ nw/tou Il.5.146, cf. 8.325, Hdt.4.62; metafre/nw| e)n do/ru ph=cen w)/mwn messhgu/s Il.5.41; teu/xe' a)p' w)/mwn sulh/sein 15.544; w)=mos s ribaro/s, w)=moi i)/fqimoi, 5.400, 18.204; eu)re/es 3.210; kurtw/ 2.217; a)mf' w)/moisin e)/xei sa/kos 11.527, cf. S.Fr.453; e)p' w)/mou . . fe/rein Od.10.170, cf. Isoc.19.39; a)rei=t' e)p' w)/mou Herod.3.61; kat' w)/mou dei=ron ib.3; e)p' w)/mwn pate/r' e)/xwn S.Fr.373; ta\ w)=ta e)pi\ tw=n w)/mwn e)/xein Pl.R.613c; w)/moisi fo/rhsen Il.19.11; e(lw\n . . sa/kos w)/mw| 15.474; w)/mw| or w)/moisin e)/xein, 14.376, 1.45, al.; w)/mois or e)p' w)/mois fe/rein, S.Fr.454, Tr564; e)/xein a)na\ faidi/mw| w)/mw| Od.11.128, 23.275; labw\n . . w)=mon ei)s a)ristero/n E.IT1381; e)p' w)/mois qei=nai Id.Ba.755; ki/on' ou)ranou= . . w)/mois e)rei/dwn A.Pr.350; w)/moisi toi=si e)moi=si 'by the strength of mine
arms', Hdt.2.106; a)postre/yai to\n w)=. to dislocate
it, Ar.Eq.263 (troch.); o( d' w)=mos . . pie/zetai Id.Ra.30; to\n w)=mon qli/bomai Id.Fr.323: pl. for sg., w)/mois a)risteroi=sin a)nakla/sas de/rhn E.Or.1471.
the shoulder is sts. more exactly specified as prumno/tatos or prumno\s w)=mos, Od.17.462,504; nei/atos w)=. Il.15.341, 17.310; sts. opp. xei/r (the arm), xei=res w)/mwn . . e)pai/+ssontai 23.628; tw=n e(kato\n me\n xei=res a)p' w/)mwn a)i/+ssonto Hes.Th.150; tou\s w)/mous a)potamo/ntes su\n th=|si xersi/ (arms) Hdt.4.62; a)potamo/nta e)n tw=| w)/mw| th\n xei=ra Id.2.121.e/, cf. E.Ba.1127, Arist.HA493b26. also of animals. as of a horse, Il.6.510, 15.267, X.Eq.8.6; of a lion, Hes.Sc.430; of a dog, X.Cyn.4.1; of crabs, Batr.296; of birds, Plu.2.983b; of ants, Gp.13.10.14.
the shoulder, in a dress, e)pi\ tw=n w)/mwn th=s e)pwmi/dos LXX Ex.28.12, cf. 25(29); e)pi\ tw=| w)/mw| tou= xitw=nos u(poqe/ntes Aen.Tact.31.23 codd. (e)pi\ th=| w)/|a| cj. Haupt). metaph. of
the parts below the top or
head of any thing, esp. of
the fork of a vine (cf. w)moxa/rac), Gp.4.12.4; of the womb, Heroph. ap. Gal.4.596, cf. Ruf.Onom.195. (Cf. Lat.
umerus (fr.
*omesos), Goth.
ams (stem
amsa-), Skt.
áṃsas, also Aeol. e)p-omma/dios, and (non-Greek) a)me/sw Hsch.）

w)mo/s, h/, o/n: (v. sub fin.):—
raw, crude (cf. Arist.Mete.380b5): prop. of flesh,
raw, uncooked, Il.22.347, al.; opp. o)ptale/os, Od.12.396; w)mo\n katafagei=n tina or w)mou= e)sqi/ein tino/s to eat one
raw, prov. of savage cruelty, X.An.4.8.14, HG3.3.6; so w)mo\n bebrw/qois *pri/amon Il.4.35, cf. Od.18.87, etc. of eggs, Thphr. Vert.2; of vegetables, mu/khtas w)mou\s . . fagei=n Antiph.188; kriqai/ Luc.Asin.17; cf. w)mh/lusis. of water,
crude, opp. a)/pefqos, Alex.198; also of milk, Arist.Mete.380b8. of fruit,
uncooked by the sun, unripe, opp. pe/pwn, Ar.Eq.260 (troch.), cf. X.Oec.19.19 (Comp.), Arist.Mete.380b7. of pitch, opp. e(fqh/, Gp.6.5.5, cf. Plb.5.89.6; of pottery,
unbaked, xu/trai Dsc.1.68, Gp.10.21.1; ke/ramos w)mo/s Arist.Mete.380b8, cf. GA743a9: even of soil which needs to be exposed to the sun, w(s h( w)mh\ au)th=s o)ptw=|to X.Oec.16.15. of food,
undigested, Anon.Lond.25.7, al., Plu.2.131c, 133d; of a person,
suffering from indigestion, Philostr.Gym.54; also ou)=ra, u(poxwrh/seis, kata/rroi, Arist.Mete.380b5. metaph.,
savage, fierce, cruel, [despo/tai] w)moi/ te dou/lois A.Ag.1045; w). fro/nhma Id.Th.536; w)mh=| cu\n o)rgh=| Id.Supp.187; dai/mwn S.OT828; ta\ . . *)agame/mnonos klu/eis w)ma\ kai\ pa/ntolm' E.IA913 (troch.); w)mo\s e)/s tina Id.Hipp.1264; and so in Prose, w)mo\n to\ bou/leuma . . e)gnw=sqai Th. 3.36; ou(/tws w)mh\ <h(> sta/sis prou)xw/rhse ib.82; qhreutai\ w)moi\ kai\ a)/nomoi Pl.Lg.823e; w)mh\ yuxh/ ib.718d; xalepo\s kai\ w). X.An.2.6.12; to\n ou(/tws w)mo/n, to\n ou(/tws a)gnw/mona D.21.97; w)moi\ xro/noi
hard times, IG3.1372 (metr.). Adv., w)mw=s kai\ a)paraith/tws Th.3.[84], cf. X. Vect.5.6; w). kai\ sxetli/ws e)/xein Isoc.19.31; w). kai\ pikrw=s D.29.2; w). a)poktei/nein Lys.13.63 codd. o(moi/ws Lipsius): Sup., w)mo/tata diakei=sqai pro/s tina Isoc.9.49.
harsh, rough, cruel, no/moi S.Aj.548; dhloi= to\ ge/nnhm' w)mo\n e)c w)mou= patro/s Id.Ant.471; pw=s a)\n w)mo/teros sukofa/nths genoit';
a more coarse, more unmitigated sycophant,
D.18.212. Adv. w)mw=s
rudely, coarsely, parelqei=n w). kai\ a)naidw=s ib. 285. (from 1.4) w)mo\n gh=ras an
unripe, premature old age, Od. 15.357, Hes.Op.705 (but w)mo/taton kai\ a)griw/taton gh=ras in signf. 11.1, Plu.Mar.2), cf. w)moge/rwn : w)mo\s to/kos an
untimely birth, Philostr. VS2.1.8. (Cf. Skt.
āmás 'raw, uncooked'.)

w)mo-si_ti/a, h(,
feeding on raw flesh, Str.15.2.10.

w)mo/-si_tos, on,
eating raw meat, of the Sphinx,
eating men raw, A.Th.541; xalai/ (also of the Sphinx) E.Ph.1025 (lyr.); sku/lakes Id.Ba.338. Pass.,
eaten raw, Lyc.654.

w)mo-spa/raktos [a^r], on,
torn in pieces raw, Ar.Eq.345.

w)mo-ta/ri_xos [a^], o(, prob.
pickled flesh of the tunny's shoulder, Nicostr.Com.1, Alex.15.4, Matro Conv.17, Dsc.2.31:— also w)mo-ta/ri_xon, to/, Diph.Siph. ap. Ath.3.121b.

w)mo/ths, htos, h(,
rawness, crudeness, opp. pe/pansis Arist.Mete. 380b4.
indigestion, crudity, Thphr.Lass.4, D.S.10.7: pl., w)mo/thsin a(li/sketai Plu.2.661b, cf. Dsc.3.1. metaph.,
savagery, fierceness, cruelty, S.Inach. in PTeb.692 iv 15, E.Ion47, X.Cyr.4.5.19, Isoc.4.112, 11.32, D.21.109, etc.; i)/son leai/nhs kai\ gunaiko\s w). Men. Mon.267; ei)/s tinas LXX 2 Ma.12.5; w). kata/ tinos Luc.Phal.1.6: pl., Id.VH1.3, J.BJ7.8.1.

w)motok-e/w,
bring forth untimely, miscarry, LXXJb.21.10; w)motokou=sai/ te . . kai\ nekra\ ti/ktousai D.H.9.40.

w)motok-i/a, h(,
premature childbirth, Ptol.Tetr.149, Sor.2.47.

w)mo/tok-os (parox.), on,
bringing forth immature offspring, le/aina Call.Cer.53; w)moto/kous w)di=nas a)phrei/santo le/ainai Id.Del.120 (referring to the shapelessness of the lion cub at birth): metaph. of a vine, AP9.561 (Phil.).

w)mo-tome/w,
cut an abscess
before it is ripe or
fully purulent, Paul. Aeg.6.34:—hence w)mo-tomhte/on, Archig. ap. Gal.12.677.

w)mo-tri^bh/s, e/s,
pressed raw, w). e)/laion oil
from unripe olives, preferred for many purposes, Thphr.Od.15, Dsc.1.30.

w)mo/-u+pnos, on,
with one's sleep not slept out, w). a)nista/nai tina/ Eup.305; a)naphdh=sai w). Philostr. VA8.31.

w)mofa^g-e/w,
eat raw flesh, Str.15.2.2, Arr.Ind.28.1, Porph.Abst. 1.13, Gp.19.2.13.

w)mofa^g-i/a, h(,
eating of raw flesh, Plu.2.417c (pl.).

w)mofa^/g-ion, to/,
a victim eaten raw, Milet.6.22 (iii B. C.).

w)mo/fa^g-os (parox.), on,
eating raw flesh, carnivorous, of savage beasts, le/ontes, qw=es, lu/koi, Il.5.782, 11.479, 16.157; qh=res h.Ven.124; of the Centaurs, Thgn. 542; of savage men, Th.3.94, Str.15.1.57, Porph.Abst.1.13; of certain daemons, w)mofa/goi xqo/nioi PMag.Par.1.1444; ta\ w).
carnivores, Hp.Vict.2.49 cod.M, Arist.HA608b25, PA694a1; w). xa/ris (cf. a)ndrobrw/s) E.Ba.139 (lyr.). rarely proparox. w)mo/fa^gos, on, Pass.,
eaten raw, of sacrifices offered to Dionysus, E.Fr.472.12 (anap., ta/s t' w)mofa/gous dai/tas tele/sas codd. perh. rightly, cf. w)mofa/gion).

w)mo-fo/rion, to/, =
palliolum, Gloss.

w)mo-fo/ros, o(, (w)=mos)
porter, AJA42.56 (Tarsus, iii A. D.).

w)mo/-frwn, onos, o(, h(, (frh/n)
savage-minded, lu/kos A.Ch.421 (lyr.); of persons, S.Aj.930 (lyr.), Tr.975 (anap.), Ph.194 (anap.), E.El. 27, LXX 4 Ma.9.15, etc.: metaph., w). si/daros A.Th.730 (lyr.). Adv. w)mofro/nws Id.Pers.911 (anap.), cj. in J.Vit.35.

w)mo-xa/rac [a^], a^kos, o( or h(,
a prop for the forks of vines (v. w)=mos 11), Gp.5.22.4.

w)mo-xeirou/rghtos, on,
premature, of a surgical operation, w). poih=sai th\n xeirourgi/an Steph.in Hp.1.180d.
w)mfu/nw, f.l. for o)mfu/nw in Hsch. w)=n, Ion. and Dor. for ou)=n.
w)=na, w)=nac, poet. contr. for w)= a)/na, w)= a)/nac.
w)na/mhn, w)/nato, aor. Med. of o)/nomai. also of o)ni/nhmi (q.v.). w)na/rxos: dh=myos, Hsch.
w)na_ta/s, a=, o(, Dor. for w)nhth/s, GDI2146.8 (Delph., ii B. C.).

w)ne/omai, Hes.Op.341, etc.: fut. -h/somai E.Hec.360, Ar.Ach.815, Pax1261, Lys.22.22, Dor. w)nasou=mai (v. infr.):—in Att. usu. with the syllabic augment, e)wnou/mhn Eup.184, And.1.134, a)nt-ewnei=to X. Oec.20.26, etc.: but w)ne/eto Hdt.3.139, w)ne/onto Id.1.69, w)nou/mhn Lys. 7.4 codd., a)nt-wnei=to And.1.134, e)c-wnei=to Aeschin.3.91: aor. 1 e)wnhsa/mhn Plu.Cic.3; w)nhsa/mhn Hp.Ep.17, Plu.Nic.10, Luc.Herm.81; part. w)nhsa/menos Plb.4.50.3, D.H.7.20: w)nh/sasqai not in Attic inscrr. earlier than IG22.1035.8 (i B. C.), e)pria/mhn being used in Att.; w)nhsa/mhn in the prov. *xi=os despo/thn w)nh/sato Eup.269: pf. e)w/nhmai in act. sense, Ar.Pl.7, Lys.7.2 (so plpf. e)w/nhto D.37.5); also as Pass. (v. infr. 11): aor. in pass. sense (v. infr. 11) e)wnh/qhn; fut. in pass. sense a)p-wnhqh/setai Theopomp.Com.84: this verb is usu. replaced in later Gr. by a)gora/zw:—
buy, purchase, opp. pwle/w, pipra/skw; pw= tis w)=n o)/non w)nasei=tai; Sophr.125; but in pres. and impf. (which are the tenses most in use),
offer to buy, bargain or
bid for a thing, o)/fr' a)/llwn w)nh=| klh=ron Hes.Op.341; w)ne/esqai tw=n forti/wn
wished to buy some of their wares,
began to bargain for them, Hdt. 1.1; *kroi=so/s sfi w)neome/noisi e)/dwke gave it them
when they offered to buy, ib.69; ta\s nh/sous ou)k e)bou/lonto w)neume/noisi pwle/ein ib.165, cf. 3.139, 6.121; o)ktw\ la/bois a)/n (sc. o)bolou/s); Answ. ei)/per w)nei= to\n e(/teron if
you are willing to buy the other fish, Alex.16.10, cf. 78.7; w)nei=sqai kai\ pwlei=n pro\s a)llh/lous Pl.Lg.741b; w). ta\s gunai=kas para\ tw=n gone/wn Hdt.5.6, cf. Pl.Prt.313d, 313e, D.9.48; a)po/ tinos Ach.Tat. 5.17: c. dat. pers.,
buy from . . , Ar.Ach.815, Pax1261; also w). e)k *kori/nqou
buy goods from Corinth, X.HG7.2.17: w). e)c a)gora=s Id.An. 3.2.21; metaph., kairo/n, sponda/s w)., Plu.Sert.6, Hdn.6.7.9; w). mh\ a)dikei=sqai tou\s e)mpo/rous D.8.25; c. gen. pretii,
buy for so much, Hdt. 5.6, cf. E.Hec.360, X.An.7.6.24; yuxh=s
at the price of life, Heraclit. 85: also c. dat.,
buy with . . , ta)/xqista toi=si filta/tois w)nou/meqa E.IA 1170: abs., X.Mem.2.10.4, Ages.1.18: esp. in partic., w)noume/nous e(/cein ta\ e)pith/deia
by purchase, Id.An.2.3.27, cf. 5.5.14, etc.; also o( w)nou/menos the
buyer, purchaser, o(rw=ntos tou= w)noume/nou Id.Eq.3.2, cf. Plu. Cat.Mi.36; o( e)wnhme/nos the
owner by purchase (of a slave), Ar.Pl.7; o( w)nhsa/menos Plu.2.242d; o( w)nhso/menos the
intending purchaser, Din. 3.10: metaph., xa/ritas ponhra\s w). E.Hel.902; o(/sa a)/nqrwpoi a)/qlwn w)nou=ntai X.Hier.9.11; eu)/noian para/ tinos D.12.20; w). ta\s au(tw=n yuxa\s para\ tw=n e)xqrw=n Lys.28.9:—in A.Supp.337 Robortello restored o)/noito.
bid for, purchase the farming of public taxes or
properties, l/ tala/ntwn And.1.134, Lys.7.2 (in part. pf. Pass. with trans. sense); te/lh para\ th=s po/lews X.Vect.4.19, etc.; w). me/talla D.19.293; to\n e)wnhme/non th\n i)lu\n e)kkomi/sasqai IG12.94.20, cf. w)nh/ 11.
buy off, avert by giving hush-money, w). to\n ki/ndunon D.38.20; ta\ e)gklh/mata ib.8; tala/ntou to\ plhmme/lhma (i.e. its penalty) para/ tinos Luc.Herm.81. w). tina
to buy a person, of one who bribes, D.18.247; w)nei=tai kai\ diafqei/rei tina/s Id.9.45, cf. Plu.Phil.15. sts. used as Pass., dub. in pres. since [w)nou/mena/ te kai\ piprasko/mena] is interpol. in Pl.Phd.69b; occasionally in pf., part. e)wnhme/nos Id.R. 563b, Is.11.42, D.19.209 (but indic. e)w/nhntai Anon. ap. Arist.Rh. 1410a19 is Act. in sense): plpf. e)w/nhto Ar.Pax1182 (troch.); also in aor. e)wnh/qhn X.Mem.2.7.12, w)nhqh=| Id.Vect.4.19; part. w)nhqei/s Is.6.19, Pl.Sph.224a, Lg.850a. Act. pf. part. e)wnhkw/s, = e)wnhme/nos, Lys.Fr.135S.: aor. w)nh=sai: a)gora/sai, Zonar.: pres. w)nei=n: pwlei=n, a)polau/ein, Hsch.: the sense pwlei=n is Cretan, w)nh=n ta\ xrh/mata they shall
sell the property, Leg.Gort.5.47; ai) de/ tis . . to\ no/misma mh\ lei/oi de/ketqai h)\ karpw= w)ni/oi if any one refuses the currency or
sells for produce, SIG525.8 (Crete, iii B. C.).

w)n-h/, Aeol. o)/nna IG11(2).1064 (ii B. C.), h(, (cf. w)=nos)
buying, purchasing, w). kai\ prh=sis
buying and selling, Hdt.1.153, cf. Hyp.Ath.5, S. Fr.909, Pl.R.371d, Sph.223d; w)nh\n poiei=sqai/ tinos D.33.8, cf. Pl.Lg. 849b; di) w)nh=s Plu.2.753d; dia\ th\n w). Luc.Ind.16; e)n th=| tw=n siti/wn w). Pl.Prt.314a.
purchase, bargain, E.Cyc.150.
contract for the farming of taxes or other sources of revenue, w)na\s pri/asqai e)k tou= dhmosi/ou And.1.73, cf. 92, Plu.Alc.5; toi\ pria/menoi ta\n w)na\n si/tou, oi)/nou, tetrapo/dwn, SIG1000.4,5,6 (Cos, i B. C.); tri\s a)napraqei/shs th=s w). IPE12.32A53 (Olbia, iii B. C.); w)na\s
omnium venditas, of the proceeds of local taxes, Cic.Att.5.16.2. in Dor. Inscrr. (also in Arg.D.37 (pl.)),
deed of sale, contract, a( w)na\ para\ *cenokra/th *delfo/n GDI1715, al. (Delph., ii B. C.); w)na\n ta\n e)n tw=| i(arw=| a)nagegramme/nan ib.1764 (ibid., ii B. C.); ta=s w). to\ a)nti/grafon IG9(1).331.5 (Chaleion, ii B. C.).
purchase-money, price, ei)s . . tw=n o(/plwn th\n w). pare/sxe trismuri/as draxma/s Lys.19.43; e)pe/qhke th=| w). ta/lanton Plu.Alc. 5.

w)/n-hma, atos, to/,
a purchase, IG12.374.190, al., 22.1172.24.

w)n-hsei/w, Desiderat. of w)ne/omai,
wish to buy, D.C.47.14.

w)/n-hsis, ews, h(,
buying, Decr.Att. ap. Poll.7.15, prob. in CIG3597b (Ilium).

w)n-hte/os, a, on,
to be bought, Pl.Lg.849c, Amphis 1.4. w)nhte/on,
one must buy, Luc.Herm.58.

w)n-hth/s, ou=, o(,
buyer, purchaser, X.Oec. 2.3, Thphr.Char.12.8, Is.Fr.173, Plu.Cat.Mi.36, etc.; tinos of something, Pl.Erx.394e, Aeschin.1.108, Plu.Ages.9; w)nhth\n labei=n to find
a purchaser, Antiph.161.7.
contractor, IG22.1596.3;
lessee of mines, ib.1587.4, al.
w)n-htia/w, = w)nhsei/w, Thphr.Char.23.7, D.C.73.11, Poll.3.80.

w)n-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
inclined to buy: Adv. -kw=s, e)/xein Ph.2.465, al.

w)n-hto/s, h/, o/n, also o/s, o/n, E.Hel.816:—
bought, of slaves, e)me\ d' w)nhth\ te/ke mh/thr Od.14.202; dou=los ou)k w)nhto\s a)ll' oi)/koi trafei/s S.OT1123, cf. E.Hec.365, Pl.Lg.841d, etc.; opp. mi/sqios, Plu.Lyc.16: but w)nhth\ du/namis a
mercenary force, opp. oi)kei/a, Th.1.121; w)n. si=tos, opp. dwrhto/s, Plu.Cor.16.
to be bought, that may be bought, e)lpi/s E.Hel.816; lo/goi Id.Fr.978; basilei=ai Pl.R.544d; a)rxai/ Arist.Pol.1273a36; fili/h APl.4.80 (Agath.): c. gen. pretii, do/ca xrhma/twn ou)k w)nhth/ not
to be bought for money, Isoc.2.32: but e)lpi\s xrh/masin w)nhth/
with money, Th. 3.40.
w)n-h/twr, oros, o(, later form of w)nhth/s, o)pwrw=n w)nh/twr oi( a)gorai=oi, su\ de\ o)pwrw/nhs le/ge Thom.Mag.p.258R.

w)n-iako/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for a sale, a)sfa/leia (deed of sale) PGrenf.1.60.17 (vi A. D.), cf. Just.Nov.120.6.2.

w)/n-ios, a, on, Aeschin.3.160; also os, on Luc.Nigr.25, Plu.Cat.Mi.21:—
to be bought, for sale, Epich. 71; pw=s o( si=tos w)/.; how's corn
selling? Ar.Ach.758, cf. Eq. 480: c. gen. pretii, ai(/matos h( a)reth\ w). Aeschin. l.c.; th=s ou)si/as ga/r ei)sin . . w)/nioi (sc. i)xqu/es) Alex.76.7; qana/tou ga/r e)stin w)/nion Men.366, cf. Phld.Mus.p.67K.; ou) ga\r a)rgi/as w)/nion h( u(gi/eia Plu.2.135b; e)s w)/nion e)lqei=n come to
market, Thgn.127 (dub. cj., w(/rion codd.); w)/nion ei)=nai to be
on sale, Pl.Lg.848a; ou(= o( oi)=nos w)/nios Is.6.20; ou(= ta\ bibli/) w)/nia Eup.304; ei)s *(rw/mhn w)/nios h)/xqh Plu.Crass. 8; oi)ke/tas w)ni/ous e)ca/gein Id.2.680e; *)attika\s i)sxa/das w)ni/ous komisqei/sas
commercially imported Attic figs, ib.173c; i)/ste o)ro/bous o)/ntas w)ni/ous, prov. of great distress, D.22.15; ta\ w)/.
goods for sale, marketwares, X.Cyr.1.2.3, Lys.22.16, D.8.67; th\n a)gora\n tw=n w)ni/wn SIG 799.22 (Cyzicus, i A. D.), cf. Wilcken Chr.41 iii 31 (iii A. D.). of a
venal magistrate, tou= strathgou= w)ni/ou o)/ntos Din.1.20; dia\ th\n a)pori/an w)/nioi Arist.Pol.1270b10; so a)rxairesi/ai w)/. Plu.Cat.Mi. 21.
w(=nnu: ou(/tws, Hsch. (Perh.Arc. or Cypr., fr. w(=s-nu, cf. Arc. tai=nnu fr. tai=s-nu, = tai=sde, Schwyzer657.30 (iv B. C.)).
w)noma/datai, 3pl. pf. Pass. of o)noma/zw, D.C.37.16.

w)nomasme/nws, Adv. part. pf. Pass. of o)noma/zw,
by giving names, Arist.Rh.1405a36.

w)=nos, o(,
price paid for a thing, o( d' a)/cion w)=non e)/dwke Od.15.388, cf. Il.21.41; a)/speton w)=non e(/loito Od.14.297; o( d' u(mi=n muri/on w)=non a)/lfoi 15.452; the person or thing bought being in gen., *auka/onos w)=non e)/dwke
for Lycaon, Il.23.746, cf. Theoc.1.58, Inscr.Delos502A17 (iii B. C.).
purchase, e)pei/gete d' w)=non o(dai/wn Od.15.445.
articles of traffic, w)=non a)mei/bontai bioth/sion A.R.2.1006, cf. D.P.
1106. (Cf. Skt.
vasnás 'price bid',
vasnám 'wage', Lat.
vēnum (fr.
*věsnom, this fr.
*v[ocaron]snom); w)=nos and w)nh/ from
*w[ocaron]snos, *w[ocaron]snā, cf. Aeol. o)/nna.）
w)nofu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(, cj. for oi)nofu/lac in Milet.3p.177No.33e (Vollgraff Mnemos.47.71).
w)=|ce, v. oi)/gw.

w)|o-bra^xh/s, e/s,
soaked in white of egg, Leonid. ap. Aët.6.1, Heliod. ap.Orib.48.33.1.

w)|o/-ga^la, aktos, to/,
eggs mixed with milk, Paul. Aeg.3.42,6.8, Aët.9.42, etc.

w)|o-genh/s, e/s,
born of an egg, Orph. H.6.2.

w)|o-gone/w,
lay eggs, Gp.14.1.4.

w)|o-goni/a, h(,
laying of eggs, Philostr.VA2.14.

w)|o-eidh/s, e/s,
egg-shaped, ovoid, Arist.HA539b12, 555b24, GA733a31, Eudox.Ars19.14; cf. w)|w/dhs. to\ w)|., = to\ u(datoeide/s, the
aqueous humour of the eye, Gal.19.358, Aët.7.1.

w)|o-qesi/a, h(,
row of eggs, i.e.
ouate border, Aristeas 62.
w)|o-qu^tika/, ta/, = w)|oskopika/, Suid. s.v. *)orfeu/s, prob. in Zos.Alch.p.245 B.
w)oioi/, v. w)aiai/,
w)oi/fion, = w)u/fion, q. v.

w)|o/n, to/, old poet. forms w)/eon, w)/ion, v. sub fin.:—
egg, ti/ktei w)|a\ e)n gh=| kai\ e)kle/pei [o( kroko/deilos] Hdt.2.68; w)|a\ xh/neia Eriph. 7; of all birds, Arist.HA559a15; but mostly of
hens' eggs, Ar. Lys.856, Fr.185, etc.; [w)|ou=] to\ leuko/n, to\ w)xro/n, Arist.HA559a18; to\ purro/n, to\ xrusou=n, Hp.Mul.2.171, Ath.9.376d; w)|a\ h(mipage/a half-boiled
eggs, Hp.Acut.（Sp.）53; e(fqa/, w)ma/, Thphr.Vert. 2; w)|o\n r(ofei=n Nicom.Com.3; katapi/nein Antiph.140.5; w)|a\ kola/ptein Anaxil.18.4(anap.); w)|a\ go/nima fertile
eggs, opp. u(phne/mia, a)/gona, Arist.GA730a6,20; also w)|a\ plh/rh Id.Mete.359a14; w)|o\n te/leion, opp. a)tele/s, Id.GA718b23,24; w)|o\n a)nemiai=on, zefu/rion, wind-
egg, Arar.6, Arist.HA560a6; smu/rnhs w)|.
lump, Hdt.2.73; o( *xro/nos e)ge/nnhsen w)|o/n Orph.Fr.54, al., cf. Epimenid.5: metaph., w)|o\n a(/pas ge/gonen he has become
bald as an egg, AP11.398 (Nicias). of the
eggs or
spawn of fish, Hdt.2.93; ta\ w)|a\ a)fia=si Arist.HA567b22, cf. 525a7; of serpents, ib.558a26; of tortoises, ib.558a4. of plants,
seed, Id.GA731a6; cf. w)|otoke/w 2.
cupping-glass, ta\ i)atrika\ w)|a\ u(e/lina o)/ntakai\ su/stoma Hero Spir.1
Prooem.: egg-shaped cup, Dinon 14. The word has the foll. forms: Att. w)|o/n (- ^), confirmed by Inscrr. w)iw=n IG11(2).224 A11,12 (Delos, iii B. C.), Papyri (w)ia\ xh/nea PCair.Zen. 130.26 (iii B. C.)), and later Mss.; Aeol. w)/ion, gen. w)i/w （_ ^ ^_), Sapph.56, 112; w)/eon lbyc.16, Semon.11, Call.Epigr.6.10, Nic.Th.192, Arat.956; w)/beon is Argive acc. to Hsch. (i.e. w)/veon）; w)|o/n oxyt. acc. to Theognost.Can.130; w)/eon proparox., ib.121. The form w)o/n, which Lat.
ovum would lead us to expect, is found only in late texts (LXX De.22.6, Ev.Luc.11.12, etc.) and is due to loss of the i in ii B. C.; cogn. with Lat.
ovum, OHG
ei, ONorse
egg (prim. Germanic ai<*>i<*>a-), whence Engl.
egg.
w)=|on, to/, = u(perw=|on, Laced. word, Clearch.41, Sch.T Il.16.184.
w)o/p, also w)o\p o)/p, a cry of the keleusth/s to give the time to the rowers, Ar.Ra.180, 208, cf.Av.1395 and Sch.

w)|o/-pwlis, idos, h(,
egg-dealer, egg-wife, Sch.Ar.Pl.427.

w)|o-skopi/a, h(,
inspection of eggs, divination from them, Suid. s.v. *(ermago/ras:— w)|o-skopika/, ta/,
a treatise thereon, attributed to Orph., Id. s.v. *)orfeu/s.

w)|o-sku/fion [u^], to/,
egg-shaped cup with a double bottom, Asclep.Myrl. ap. Ath.11.503e, cf. 488f.
w)|otok-eu/s, e/ws, o(, poet. for w)|oto/kos, Opp.H.1.750.

w)|otok-e/w,
lay eggs, Arist.HA566b1, etc.; opp. skwlhkotoke/w and zwotoke/w, Id.Pol.1256b13, GA732a28, al.; ta\ w)|otokou=nta
ouiparous animals, ib. 749a17:—Pass.,
to be produced as eggs, ta\ w)|otokou/mena ib.746a27. of plants,
produce seed, Emp.79.

w)|otok-i/a, h(,
laying of eggs, Arist.HA538a7, GA728b7; pro\ th=s w)|. before
they lay their eggs, Plu.2.637f: pl., Hld.9.22, Gp.14.7.9.

w)|o/tok-os (parox.), on,
oviparous, Arist.GA719a6, al.; of fish, Id.HA539a12, al.; o)/fies Nic.Th.136; a)ge/lh w)|.
poultry, AP9.286 (Marc.Arg.); ta\ w)|., opp. ta\ zwoto/ka, Arist.HA489a34.

w)|o=fa^ge/w,
eat eggs, Gp.14.7.5.
w)|otok-fore/w, = w)|otoke/w, EM404.36.

w)|otok-fo/ros, on,
bearing eggs or
roe, i)xqu/es Arist.HA621b20; w)di=nes w)|. the pains
of egg-laying, Opp.H.1.478.

w)|otok-fu^la^ke/w,
guard their eggs, of the males of some fish, esp. the
Silurus, Arist. HA568b13, 621a23, al.

w)pa/zomai,
gaze at, Hsch.: also a fut. w)ph/sesqai Id.: aor. w)ph/sasqai Opp.C.3.160; -h/santo ib.4.82; -h/swntai ib.3.404.—A part. Act. w)pw=ntes in EM332.9, as etym. of e(li/k-wpes.

w(=per, Dor. for o(/qenper,
whence, Theoc.3.26.

w)ph/, h(, (o)/pwpa)
view, sight, a)nth/seien e)s w)ph/n A.R.3.821, cf. 908.
look, aspect, Nic.Al.377, Th.657.
w)/pion, to/, Dim. of w)/y, = o)fru/dion, Hsch.

*)wpis, h(, = *ou)=pis, title of Artemis, Pl.Ax.371a, Alex.Aet.4.5, cf. Hdt.4.35. w)pistai/, gloss on skeroli/gges, Hsch. w)plh/, h(,
blow of the hand, Id. (dub.). w)=ptai, v. o(ra/w. *w)=r, h(, dat. pl. w)/ressin contr. for o)a/ressin (v. o)/ar), Il.5.486. w)=res, oi(,
strong towers, Hsch.

w)/ra (A), Ion. w)/rh, h(: (v. sub fin.):—
care, concern, mostly c. gen. and usu. joined with some word expressing or implying negation, w)/rh ga/r t' o)li/gh pe/letai neike/wn little
heed is there
for strifes, Hes.Op.30; a)ndro\s a)lwme/nou ou)demi/) w)/rh Tyrt.10.11; mhdemi/an w)/rhn e)/xein a(rpasqeise/wn [gunaikw=n] Hdt.1.4, cf. 3.155, Alciphr. 1.27; w)/rhn e)poih/santo ou)demi/an Hdt.9.8, cf. Herod.4.43; h)/dh ga\r e)/sxes e)lpi/d' e(s e)mou= qeou\s w)/ran tin' e(/cein; S.OC386; e)/xw de/ toi ou)d' o(/son w)/ran xei/matos Theoc.9.20; peri\ tw=n . . pleurw=n ou)demi/an w)/. e)/xeis Pl.Com.2; u(pe\r tou/twn ou)d' o)li/ghn e)/qento w)/. Ael.NA1.59; ta\ qei=a e)n mhdemia=| w)/. ti/qesqai Id.Fr.106; without a neg., ei) patro\s ne/moi tin' w)/ran S.Tr.57; ei) dei= th=s tw=n *ai)gupti/wn sofi/as . . w)/ran ti/qesqai Ael.NA 12.7. Poet. word, used in Ion. and late Prose. (Hence o)lig-wri/a, cf. Hes.Op.l.c.: prob. fr. *vw/ra, 'watching', cf. bw=roi (i. e. vw=roi）: o)fqalmoi/, Hsch., and o(ra/w; cf. ou)=ros(B).)

w(/ra or w)/ra (B), only in Ion. form w(/rh, or w)/rh, some part of a sacrificial victim, la/yetai glw=ssan, o)sfu=n dase/an, w)/rhn SIG1037.2 (Milet., iv/iii B.C.); tou\s *)/iwnas le/gein fasi\ th\n kwlh=n w(/rhn kai\ w(rai/an Sch.HQ Od.12.89: but distd. fr. kwlh=, la/yetai . . kwlh=n a)nti\ th=s w)/rhs SIGl.c.5; cf. a)/wros(B). (Perh. cogn. with Lat.
sūra.）

w(/ra (C), Ion. w(/rh, h(: Ep. gen. pl. w(ra/wn, Ion. w(re/wn: loc. pl. w(/rasi, q. v.
any period, fixed by natural laws and revolutions, whether of the year, month, or day (the sense 'day' is implied in the compd. e(pta/wros, q. v.), nukto/s te w(/ran kai\ mhno\s kai\ e)niautou= X.Mem. 4.7.4, cf. E.Alc.449(lyr.), Pl.R.527d; tou= gnw/monos h( skia\ e)piou=sa e)pi\ ta\s gramma\s shmai/nei ta\s w(/ras tou= e)niautou= kai\ th=s h(me/ras IG12(8).240 (Samothrace): but specially, in Hom.,
part of the year, season; mostly in pl., the
seasons, o(/te te/traton h)=lqen e)/tos kai\ e)ph/luqon w(=rai Od.2.107, 19.152; a)ll' o(/te dh\ mh=ne/s te kai\ h(me/rai e)ceteleu=nto, a)\y peritellome/nou e)/teos, kai\ e)ph/luqon w(=rai 11.295, 14.294; a)ll' o(/te dh/ r(' e)niauto\s e)/hn, peri\ d' e)/trapon w(=rai 10.469, cf. Hes. Th. 58; *dio\s w(=rai Od.24.344, cf. Pi.O.4.2; o( ku/klos tw=n w(re/wn e)s tw)uto\ periiw/n Hdt.2.4, cf. 1.32; duw/deka me/rea dasame/nous tw=n w(re/wn e)s [to\n e)niauto/n] Id.2.4; ou) metalla/ssousi ai( w(=rai ib.77; peritellome/nais w(/rais S.OT156 (lyr.); pa/sais w(/rais at all
seasons, Id.Fr.592.6 (lyr.), Ar.Av.696 (anap.); w(=rai e)tw=n kai\ e)niautw=n Pl.Lg.906c, cf. Smp.188a, etc.; th=s . . w(/ras tou= e)niautou= tau/ths ou)/shs, e)n h(=| a)sqenou=sin a)/nqrwpoi ma/lista Th.7.47; xaleph\ w(/. a bad
season, Pl.Prt.344d; a) d' w)/ra xale/pa Alc.39; h( w(/. au(/th this
season, X.Cyn.7.1, cf. 5.6; kata\ ta\s w(/ras according to the
seasons, Arist.GA786a31; oi( peri\ th\n w(/ran xro/noi Id.Pol.1335a37.—Hom. and Hes. distinguish three seasons, and express each by the sg. w(/rh, with a word added to specify each:
spring, e)/aros . . w(/rh Il.6.148; w(/rh ei)arinh/ 2.471, 16.643, Od.18.367, etc.; so in Trag. and Att., h)=ros w(/ra or w(=rai, Ar.Nu.1008 (anap.), E.Cyc.508 (lyr.); w(/ra ne/a Ar.Eq.419; nea=nis E.Ph.786 (lyr.); v. infr. 2.
summer, qe/reos w(/rh Hes.Op.584, 664; w(/ra qerinh/ X.Cyn.9.20, Pl.Epin.987a, etc.
winter, xei/matos w(/rh Hes.Op.450; w(/rh| xeimeri/h| Od.5.485, Hes.Op.494; xeimw=nos w(/ra| in winter, And.1.137; xionobo/los Plu.2.182e.—A. also names three seasons, Pr.454sq.; an Egyptian division of the year, acc. to D.S.1.26.—A fourth first appears in Alcm.76, qe/ros kai\ xei=ma kw)pw/ran tri/tan kai\ te/traton to\ vh=r; and in Hp.Vict.3.68, xeimw/n, h)=r, qe/ros, fqino/pwron; w(/ras fai/nomen h(mei=s h)=ros xeimw=nos o)pw/ras Ar.Av.709 (anap.); tetra/morfoi w(=rai E(?).Fr.943 (hex.): later, seven seasons are named, e)/ar, qe/ros, o)pw/ra, fqino/pwron, sporhto/s, xeimw/n, futalia/ Gal.17(1).17. esp.
prime of the year, springtime, o(/sa fu/lla kai\ a)/nqea gi/gnetai w(/rh| Od.9.51, cf. Il.2.468; para\ th\n kaqesthkui=an w(/ran Th.4.6. in historians,
the campaigning season, to\n th=s w(/ras ei)s to\n peri/ploun xro/non X.HG6.2.13; esp. in the phrase w(/ra e)/tous, Th.2.52, 6.70, Pl.Phdr.229a, Lg.952e, D.50.23, Thphr.CP3.23.2; ei)s e)/tous w(/ran next
season, Plu.Per.10.
the year generally, th=s w(/rhs me/son qe/ros Hdt.8.12; e)n th=| pe/rusin w(/ra| last
year, D.56.3; ei)s w(/ras next
year, Philem.116, Pl.Ep.346c, LXX Ge.18.10, AP11.17 (Nicarch.), cf. Plu.Ages.22; also ei)s a)/llas w(/ras
hereafter, E.IA122 (lyr.); e)s ta\s w(/ras ta\s e(te/ras Ar.Nu.562 (lyr.); e)k tw=n w(rw=n ei)s ta\s w(/ras Id.Th.950 (anap.); kh)s w(/ras kh)/peita
next year and for ever, Theoc.15.74; also w(/rais e)c w(ra=n Isyll.25; cf. w(/rasin. in pl., of
the climate of a country,
as determined by its seasons, Hdt.1.142, cf. 149, 4.199 (here perh. three
harvest seasons); ta\s w(/. ka/llista kekrhme/nas Id.3.106; cf. Pl.Criti.111e, Phd. 111b;
climatic conditions, Hdt.2.26.
time of day, nukto\s e)n w(/rh| h.Merc.67, 155, 400; ai( w(=. th=s h(me/ras the
times of day, i.e. morning, noon, evening, and night, X.Mem.4.3.4; di' w(/ran h(me/ras by
the time of day (fixed for meetings), D.Prooem.49, etc.; pa=san w(/. th=s h(me/ras Arist.Mete.371b31; mesonukti/ois poq' w(/rais Anacreont.31.1: without h(me/ras or nukto/s, e(ka/sths h(me/ras me/xri tri/tou me/rous w(/ras Pl. Lg.784a; th=s w(/ras mikro\n pro\ du/ntos h(li/ou X.HG7.2.22; yeusqei\s th=s w(/. having mistaken the
hour, And.1.38; e)poi/hsan e)/cw me/swn nuktw=n th\n w(/ran, i.e. they prolonged the
day beyond midnight, D.54.26; th=s w(/ras e)gi/gnet' o)ye/ Id.21.84; o)yi/teron th=s w(/. PTeb.793 xi 12 (ii B. C.); pollh=s w(/ras
it being late, Plb.5.8.3; h)/dh w(/ra pollh/ Ev.Marc.6.35; a)/xri pollh=s w(/ras till
late in the day, D.H.2.54.
duration, interval or
lapse of time, meta\ i(kanh\n w(/ran tou= katenexqh=nai to\n pe/lekun e)cakou/etai h( th=s plhgh=s fwnh/ S.E.M.5.69;
length of time, term, *)/artemis e)nne/' e)tw=n deka/das bi/on *)artemidw/rw| e)/kxrhsen, trei=s d' w(/rai(date.) e)/ti prose/qhke *pronoi/h IG12(3).1350.3 (Thera, ii B. C.); e)pi\ pollh\n w(/. for a long
time, J.AJ8.4.4. the nuxqh/meron was prob. first divided into twenty-four
hours by Hipparch., e)n po/sais w(/rais i)shmerinai=s (equinoctial
hours) e(/kaston tw=n a)/strwn h)\ du/nei h)\ a)nate/llei 2.4.5, cf. Ptol.Alm.3.9, 4.9, al. in ordinary life the day from sunrise to sunset was divided into twelve equal parts called w(=rai （w(=rai kairikai/ when it was necessary to distinguish them from the w(=rai i)shmerinai/, v. kairiko/s 2 c), h(me/ra h( . . dwdeka/wros, toute/stin h( a)po\ a)natolh=s me/xri du/sews S.E.M.10.182; ou)xi\ dw/deka/ ei)sin w(=rai th=s h(me/ras; Ev.Jo.11.9; w(ra/wn a)mfi\ duwdeka/di AP9.782 (Paul.Sil.); the time of day was commonly given without the Art., w(/ra| a_ PHamb.1.96.3 (ii A. D.), tri/ths w(/ras Plu.Rom.12; o)gdo/hs, e)na/ths, deka/ths w(/., Id.Alex.60, Aem.22, Ant.68, etc.; but we have peri\ th\n tri/thn w(/ran, peri\ th\n e(ndeka/thn, Ev.Matt.20.3,6, beside peri\ e(/kthn kai\ e)nna/thn w(/. ib.5;
xqe\s w(/ran e(bdo/mhn Ev.Jo.4.52, cf. IG5(1).1390.109 (Andania, i B. C.), etc.; e)rwta=| se *xairh/mwn deipnh=sai . . au)/rion, h(/tis e)sti\n ie, a)po\ w(/ras q_ -to-morrow the 15th at 9
o'clock, POxy.110 (ii A. D.): prov., dwdeka/ths w(/., as we say 'at the eleventh
hour', Plu.Crass.17. ta\ duw/deka me/rea th=s h(me/rhs para\ *babulwni/wn e)/maqon oi( *(/ellhnes Hdt. 2.109; here h(me/rh means the nuxqh/meron, and the me/rea were each = 2 w(=rai i)shmerinai/; these
double hours (Assyr.
kaš-bu) are called w(=rai by Eudox., h(/misu zw|di/ou . . , o(/ e)stin w(/ras h(/misu Ars14.11, cf. 16.2; cf. dwdeka/wros 11. Astrol.,
degree of the zodiac rising at the nativity (cf. w(rono/mos 11, w(rosko/pos 11), w(/. meropospo/ros, teknospo/ros, Man.4.577, 597; e)c w(/rhs e)sorw=n *zeu\s *(ermei/hn Jupiter in the
ascendant in aspect with Mercury, Id.3.186, cf. 32, al.
the fitting time or
season for a thing (mostly without Art., even in Att.), freq. in Hom. (v. infr.); w(/ra suna/ptei Pi.P.4.247; w(=rai e)peigo/menai Id.N.4.34; o(/tan w(/. h(/kh| X.Mem.2.1.2; but with Art., th=s w(/. e)nqumei=sqai Id.Cyn.8.6: freq. in later writers, th=s w(/ras e)pigenome/nhs Plb.2.34.3, etc. c. gen. rei, w(/rh koi/toio, mu/qwn, u(/pnou,
the time for bed, tale-telling, or sleep, Od.3.334, 11.379, cf. Hdt.1.10; w(/rh do/rpoio Od.14.407; peri\ a)ri/stou w(/ran Th.7.81, X.HG1.1.13; poluhra/tou e)s ga/mou w(/rhn Od.15.126; e)s ga/mou w(/rhn a)pike/sqai Hdt. 6.61; ga/mwn e)/xein w(/ran D.H.5.32; so ei)s a)ndro\s w(/ran h(/kousa
time for a husband, Pl.Criti. 113d; w(/rh a)ro/tou, a)mh/tou, Hes.Op.460, 575; me/xri a)ro/tou w(/rhs IG7.235.3 (Oropus, iv B. C.); karpw=n w(=rai Ar.Ra. 1034 (anap.); h( w(/ra th=s o)xei/as Arist.HA509b20; tou= fwleu/ein ib. 579a26, etc.; also w(/ran ei)=xon paideu/esqai I was of
age to . . Is.9.28. w(/ra [e)sti/n] c. inf.,
it is time to do a thing, a)lla\ kai\ w(/rh eu(/dein Od.11.330, cf. 373; so also in Trag. and Att., E.Ph. 1584, Heracl.288 (anap.), Ar.Ec.30, Pl.Prt.361e, 362a; so dokei= ou)x w(/ra ei)=nai kaqeu/dein X.An.1.3.11, cf. HG7.2.13 (dub. l.): c. acc. et inf., w(/ra d' e)mpo/rous kaqie/nai a)/gkuran A.Ch.661, cf. S.OT466 (lyr.): c. dat. et inf., X.Cyr.4.5.1, Pl.Tht.145b: in these phrases the inf. pres. is almost universal; the aor., however, occurs in Od.21.428, S.Aj.245 (lyr.), Ar.Ach.393 (where also e)sti/ is added to w(/ra, as in Philyll.3, a)fairei=n w(/ra 'sti\n h)/dh ta\s trape/zas); and the pf. in w(/ra pepau=sqai Plu.2.728d: sts. the inf. must be supplied, ou)de/ ti/ se xrh/, pri\n w(/rh, katale/xqai Od.15.394, cf. E.El.112 (lyr.), Ar.Ec.877; w(/ra kh)s oi)=kon (i. e. i)e/nai ei)s oi)=kon) Theoc.15.147. in various adverb. usages, th\n w(/rhn
at the right time, Hdt.2.2, 8.19, X.Oec.20.16: but th\n w(/.
at that
hour, Hes.Sc.401; tau/thn th\n w(/ran
at this
season, X.Cyn.9.1; [h( i)=ris] pa=san w(/ran gi/gnetai th=s h(me/ras Arist.Mete.371b31; dei/elon w(/rhn pau/omai a)mh/toio A.R. 3.417; w(/ran ou)deno\s koinh\n qew=n
at an hour . . , A.Eu.109, cf. E.Ba. 724, Aeschin.1.9; au)th=s w(/ras immediately, PMich. in Class.Phil.22.255(iii A. D.); e)n w(/rh| in
due season, in
good time, Od.17.176, Hdt. 1.31, cf. Pi.O.6.28, Ar.V.242, etc.; also ai)ei\ ei)s w(/ras in successive
seasons, Od.9.135; e)s ta\s w(/ras for
all time, Ar.Ra.382 (lyr. cf. supr. A. 1.3) (hence in an acclamation [e] i)s w(/ras pa=si toi=s th\n po/lin filou=sin
hurrah for . . , POxy.41.29 (iii/iv A. D.)); oi( w(=de xe/zontes ei)s w(/. mh\ e)/lqoien Milet.2(3) No.406, cf. w(/rasi; kaq' w(/ran Theoc.18.12, Plb.1.45.4, cf. 3.93.6, etc.; opp. par' w(/rhn AP7.534 (Alex.Aet. or Autom.), cf. Plu.2.784b, etc.:—pro\ th=s w(/ras X.Oec.20.16; pro\ w(/ras Luc.Luct.13; pro\ w(/ras teleuth=sai IG42(1).84.26 (Epid., i A. D.); pri\n w(/ras Pi.P.4.43 (cf. pri/n A. 11.4). metaph.,
the spring-time of life, the bloom of youth, Mimn.3.1; w(/ran e)xou/sas A.Supp.997, cf. Th.13, 535; pai=das pro\s te/rmasin w(/ras Ar.Av.705 (anap.); pa/ntes oi( e)n w(/ra| Pl.R.474d; ou)k e)nw(/., = presbu/teros, Id.Phdr. 240d; e)a\n e)pi\ w(/ra| h)=| Id.R.474e; e(/ws a)\n e)n w(/ra| w)=si Id.Men.76b; pausame/nou th=s w(/. prob. in Id.Phdr.234a; a)nqei=n e)n w(/. Id.R.475a; th\n w(/. diafula/cai a)/baton toi=s ponhroi=s Isoc.10.58; lh/gein w(/ras, opp. a)nqei=n, Pl.Alc.1.131e; e(s e)pigino/meno/n ti te/los, oi(=on toi=s a)kmai/ois h( w(/ra Arist.EN1174b33, cf. 1157a8. freq. involving an idea of
beauty, feu= feu= th=s w(/ras tou= ka/llous Ar.Av.1724(lyr.); w(/ra| . . h(liki/as lampro/s Th.6.54; ka/llei kai\ w(/ra| dienegko/ntes Aeschin.1.134, cf. ib.158; kalo\s w(/ra| te kekrame/nos Pi.O.10(11).104, cf. X.Mem. 2.1.22, Pl.Lg.837b; a)f' w(/ras e)rga/zesqai
quaestum corpore facere, Plu.
Tim..14, cf. X.
Mem..1.6.13, Smp.8.21; th\n w(/. pepwlhko/tes Phld.Rh.1.344 S.:—then, generally,
