beauty, grace, elegance of style, D.H.Pomp.2, Plu.2.874b, etc.; gluku/ths kai\ w(/. Hermog.Id.2.3, cf. Men.Rh.p.335 S., Him.Or.1.2; of
beauty in general, xa/ris kai\ w(/ra Plu.2.128d. *(/wra personified, like *(/hbh, Pi.N.8.1. = ta\ w(rai=a, the
produce of the season, fruits of the year, a)po\ th=s w(/ras e)tre/fonto X.HG2.1.1. personified, ai(*(=wrai, the
Hours, keepers of heaven's cloudgate, Il.5.749, 8.393; and ministers of the gods, ib.433; *zeu=, teai\ . . *(=wrai Pi.O.4.2; esp. of Aphrodite, h.Hom.6.5,12; also *(=w. *dionusia/des, *karneia/des, Simon.148, Call.Ap.87; three in number, Eunomia, Dike, Eirene, daughters of Zeus and Themis, Hes.Th. 901; *wrai polua/nqemoi Pi.O.13.17, cf. Alex.261.6, Theoc.1.150, etc.: freq. joined with the *xa/rites, h.Ap.194, Hes.Op.75; worshipped at Athens, Paus.9.35.1; at Argos, Id.2.20.5; at Attaleia, BMus.Inscr.1044 (i B. C.).
w(rai/a, h(, v. w(rai=os 1.3. v. w(/ra (B).

w(ra_i/+zw, Att. contr. w(ra/|zw, (w(rai=os)
beautify, adorn, Aristid. Quint.2.6:—but mostly Pass.,
bloom with youthful beauty, Cratin.272; ai( pareiai\ w(. Callistr.Stat.6; e)n trisi\n w(rai/+sqhn LXX Si. 25.1; e)n ka/llei Aristaenet.2.10; w(rai+sme/nh e)pikth/tois sofi/smasi
tricked out, Luc.Am.38:—so intr. in Act., w(ra/|zwn h(liki/a| IG12(7).53.7 (Amorgos, iii A. D.).
give oneself airs, behave affectedly, w(ra|zome/nh kai\ qruptome/nh Eup.358; w(s w(rai/+zeq' (leg. w(ra/|zeq'） h( tu/xh pro\s tou\s bi/ous Men.855; Meineke restores w(ra/|zetai (cod. Rav. o(rei/zetai) for o(ri/zetai in Ar.Ec.202. Med.,
make display (of one's oratory), Chor.Zach.1.8.

w(raio/-karpos, on,
with ripe or
timely fruit, Tz.H.4.691.

w(raio-ko/mos, on,
studying dress or
decoration, Suid.

w(raio/-omai, Pass.,
to be beautiful, LXX Ca.1.10, 7.1,6; w(raiw/qhs moi sfo/dra 2 Ki.1.26.

w(raio-pole/w,
live with the young, Suid.:—but cf. w(rapolei=n.

w(raio-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
selling fresh fruits, also = tarixopw/lhs, Hsch.; also = o( th\n a)kmh\n pwlh/sas, Id.

w(rai=os, a, on,
produced at the right season (w(/ra),
seasonable, timely: esp. of the fruits of the earth, bi/os or bi/otos w(. store of
fruits gathered in due season, Hes.Op.32,307; w(. karpoi/ the fruits
of the season, karpou\s . . katati/qesqai w(rai/ous to store them up
in season, Hdt.1.202: freq. in neut., w(rai=a, ta/, Th.1.120, 3.58, X.An.5.3.9, Pl.Lg.845e; e(rai/ws ta\ w(rai=a a)podido/nai Hp.Aph.3.8; w(rai=a . . a)potelei=n i(era/ to render
fruits of the season as sacred offerings, Pl.Criti. 116c, cf. Orac. ap. D.21.52; trwkta\ w(. X.An.5.3.12; a)/nqea AP9.564 (Nicias); su=ka Aret.CD1.3; also of animals, w(. a)/rnes
yearling, AP6.157 (Theodorid.); of tunnies at a year old (from six months to one year they were called phlamu/des）, phlamu\s . . w(rai/a qe/rous tw=| *bospori/th| S.Fr.503; w(. qu/nnoi Ps.-Hes. ap. Ath.3.116b, cf. Hices.ib.116e, Archestr.Fr.38.9, Plaut.Capt.851; ta/rixos w(. fish
salted or
pickled in the season, Alex.186.5; i)xqu/es e)s ta/ghnon w(. Babr.6.4; sarga/nai w(.
pickling-tubs, Poll.7.27: hence generally, agricultural
produce, ei)=nai e)nexurasi/an *ai)cwneu=sin e)k tw=n w(. tw=n e)k tou= xwri/ou IG22.2492.8 (iv B. C.). ta\ w(rai=a, = ta\ katamh/nia, esp. at their first appearance, Hp.Superf.34. Subst. h( w(rai/a (in full, w(/rh h( w(rai/h Aret. SD1.4, Phryn.PSp.128 B., etc.),
harvest-time, esp. the twenty days before and twenty days after the rising of the dog-star, mi/mnei e)s w(rai/hn till
harvest-time, A.R.3.1390. the
campaigning-season, during which the troops kept the field, D.9.48, 56.30, Plb.3.16.7. th\n me\n w(rai/hn ou)k u(/ei it does not rain
in the season (sc. of rain), Hdt.4.28.
happening or
done in due season, seasonable, a)/rotos, e)/rgon, Hes.Op.617.642; plo/os ib.630; xeimw=nes Thphr.HP4.14.1; u(/data Id.CP2.2.1; skapa/nh ib.3.16.1; tomh\ [kala/mou] Id.HP4.11.4; o(/te w(rai=on ei)/h when
the weather permitted, App.Pun.120. metaph., (w(/ra (C) B)
seasonable, due, proper, w(rai/wn tuxei=n, = nomi/mwn tuxei=n (cf. w(/rios (A). 111.2), E.Supp.175: e)n w(rai/[a| e)kklhsi/a|] dub. in SIG668.4 (Delphi, ii B. C.); e)niau/tia w(. ib. 1025.37 (Cos, iv/iii B. C.), cf. Hsch. of persons,
seasonable or
ripe for a thing, c.gen., a)ndro\s w(rai/h Hdt.1.107, cf. Lys.Fr.4; ga/mwn or ga/mou w(rai=ai, Hdt.1.196, 6.122, cf. X.Cyr.4.6.9; e)s h(/bhn w(rai/an ga/mwn E.Hel.12 (w(rai/wn codd.); o(/stis ou)ke/q' w(rai=os gamei= Id.Fr.804; w(. ga/mos
seasonable marriage, A.Fr.55; also of old persons,
ripe or
ready for death, path/r ge mh\n w(. E.Alc.516; au)to\s d', e)n w). ga\r e(/stamen bi/w|, qnh/|skein e(/toimos Id.Ph.968; qa/natos w(. X.Ages.10.3; soro/s Ar.V.1365; w(rai=os a)pote/qnhken Plu.2.178e; so u(/lh w(. te/mnesqai Thphr.HP5.1.1. in reference to age,
in the prime of life, youthful, Hes.Op.695: hence
in the bloom of youth, opp. a)/wros, X.Smp.8.21, Pl.R.574c; w(. e)w\n kai\ kalo/s Pi.O.9.94; paidi/skh w(raiota/th Ar.Ach.1148 (anap.), cf. Ra.291,514; pai=s w(rai=os Id.Av.138: but not necessarily implying beauty, toi=s tw=n w(rai/wn prosw/pois, kalw=n de\ mh/ Pl.R.601b; a)/neu ka/llous w(rai=oi Arist.Rh. 1406b37; cf. w(/ra (C) B. 11. generally, of things,
beautiful, graceful, LXX Ge.3.6, 2 Ch.36.19, Ev.Matt.23.27; h( w(. pu/lh tou= i(erou= Act.Ap.3.10, cf. 3.2. irreg. Sup. w(raie/statos Epich.186d. Adv. w(rai/ws Hp.Aph.3.8.

w(raio/ths, htos, h(,
the ripeness of the fruits of the year, f.l. in Thphr.HP9.1.6.
the bloom of youth, beauty, LXXIs.44.13, al.; sw/matos X.Eph.1.1, Hld.2.1, al.: pl., X.Oec.7.43.
w(raio/fqalmos, on, gloss on eu)/wpis, Sch.Pi.O.10(11).90.

w(ra_i+smo/s, o(,
adornment, tou= sw/matos, Plu.Agis 4;
refinement, Id.2.972d; with notion of
effeminacy and affectation, LXXJe.4.30: metaph. of style,
elegance, D.H.Comp.1, Plu.Fab.1.

w(ra_i+sth/s, ou=, o(,
fop, AB225, Hsch. s.v. baukizo/menos, EM192.20.

w(ra_kia/w,
faint, swoon away, Ar.Ra.481, Pax702, and in later Prose, as Phld.Acad.Ind.p.50M., Lib.Decl.26.33, 31.34, Them.Or. 26.314b.—Moer.p.425P. writes it with the aspir., as Att. for lipoyuxe/w. Others wrote it w)rakia/w as if for w)xria/w, and this sense is given to the word by Aristaenet.1.10, Procop.Arc.10, Sch.Ar.Pax l.c.
w(ra_ki/zw, = foreg., EM823.33.

w)/ra^nos, Aeol. for ou)rano/s, Sapph.1.11, Alc.17 (but o)/ranos Sapph. 37, 64, Alc.34):—also Dor. and Boeot. w)rano/s Alcm.23.16, Corinn. Supp.2.79, and w)rani/a_fi, Adv.
in heaven, Alcm.59; cf. Boeot. *)wrani/a IG7.1804.1 (Thespiae).

entryFree.foreign: kata\ th\n ei)qisme/nhn w(/ran e(ka/stou e)/tous a)napolei=n,

div0.entryFree:
w(ra/riqmos [a^], on,
reckoning the hours, Sch.Pi.P.4.336.

w(/ra_si, w(/ra_sin (also w(/ras, Men., v. infr.), Adv.: (old loc. pl. of w(/ra (c)):—
in season, in good time, mh\ w(/rasin i(/koito, as an imprecation, may he not come
in season, i.e.
bad luck to him! Alex.266.1, Luc.DMeretr.10.3; mh\ w(/ras su/ ge . . i(/koio Men.Pk.131; mh\ w(/ras' i(/koisqe (Dind. for w(/ras) Ar.Lys.1037(troch.); o( mh\ w(/rasi that fellow—
bad luck to him! ib.391; mh\ w(/rasin i(koi/mhn, ei) . . Luc.Salt.5; also mh\ su/ g' ei)s w(/ras i(/koio Babr.53.7 (cf. w(/ra (C) B.1.4).—For the form, cf. qu/rasi, *)olumpi/asi.

w)rei=on, to/, Cret. for ou)rei=on (q. v.),
guard-house, fort, GDI5075.79 (Latos, i B. C.): w)/reia: fulakth/ria, Hsch.

w(rei=on, to/, = Lat.
horreum, EM697.32, Gp.2.28 tit.
w)rei/ths, v. w(ri/ths.
w)rei/trofos, on, poet. for o)rei/trofos, of Dionysus, cj. in AP9.524.25.

w)resi/doupos [i^], on, poet. for o)resi/doupos,
making a din on the mountains, AP9.524.25 (Scaliger for w)resi/loipos; he also suggested -koitos).

w(resi^dw/ths, ou, o(,
one who brings on the seasons, or
who gives the ripe fruits in their season, epith. of Apollo, like w(rhfo/ros, ib.525.25.
w)/ressin, v. w)=r, o)/ar.
w)/reto, v. o)/rnumi.

w)reu/w,
take care of, attend to, c. acc., Hes.Th.903, cf. Hsch., Corn.ND1:—Pass., ib.29. (Hes. and Corn. ll. cc. use the word to expl. the *(=wrai; Hsch. glosses it by to\ tw=n a)gri/wn nomw=n kai\ e)qnw=n e)pimelei=sqai: cf. o)reu/ein and ou)reu/w, of which w)reu/w might be a Dor. form.)

w)re/w, in pres. part. w)reo/ntwn: frontizo/ntwn, Hp. ap. Gal.19.157: but w(re/onta: xroni/zonta, w(=ros ga\r o( xro/nos kai\ w(rogra/foi oi( peri\ xro/nou gra/yantes, Hp. ap. Erot.: but the latter word may be imaginary, the reference being perh. to w(rai=a e)o/nta in Id.Loc.Hom.38; neither has been found in our codd. of Hp.:—we have also w)rh/santa: fula/ssonta, and w)rh/ssontai: fula/ssontai, Hsch.; w)rei=n: fula/ttein, o(/qen kai\ o( qurwro\s le/getai, Id., which together with EM 686.54, al., Corn.ND1, suggests that w)re/w is coined by Grammarians to expl. words in -wro/s.
w)/rh, w(/rh, h(, Ion. for w)/ra, w(/ra.
w)rhtu/s, u/os, h(, = ph/rwsis, Hsch. (Cf. pwrhtu/s.）

w(rhfo/ros, on,
leading on the seasons, or
bringing on the fruits in their season, epith. of Demeter, h.Cer.54, 192, 492, Orph.Fr.49.102.
w(riai/nw, = w(rai/+zw, -omai, Hsch.:—Med., Clearch.39.

w(riai=os, a, on, (w(/ra(c) A.11)
an hour long, dia/sthma Hipparch.3.5.4, al., cf. S.E.M.5.63, Ptol.Geog.1.11.1, al.; me/geqos Vett.Val.22.4.
w(ria/s, a/dos, poet. fem. of w(/rios, Orph.H.10.19.
w)ri/ggh: e)w/ra, Hsch. (w)/riggas v.l. for w)li/ggas in Poll.2.67 seems to be different).
w)ri/zeskon, v. sub o)ari/zw.
w)ri/zw, 3sg. w)ri/zei: u(pnoi=, o(milei=, fronti/zei, merimna=|, a)dolesxei=, Hsch. (i. e. partly w(ri/zei fr. w(=ros 1, partly w)r- = o)ar-, and partly w)ri/zei fr. w)/ra).

w(ri^ko/s, h/, o/n, (w(/ra)
in one's prime, blooming, of the young people, Ar.Ach.272, Fr.235; w(. ne/os Ael.NA14.5, cf. 4.8（Comp.), Alciphr. 1.13; pa/nu ga/r e)stin w(rikw/tata ta\ titqi/', w(/sper mh=lon Crates Com. 40. Adv. -kw=s, punqa/nei you ask
so maidenly, so prettily, Ar.Pl.963; cf. w(/ra (c) B. 11.
w(ri^m-a/cw, (w(/rimos) gloss on u(poperka/zw, Sch.Od.7.126.

w(ri^m-ai/a, h( (sc. a)/fesis or me/qodos), Astrol.,
reckoning from the w(/ra(C) A.11, Ptol. Tetr.131, Vett.Val.146.33, Id. in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(1).240,
Cod.Marc. Ven.335 fol.384.

w(/ri^m-os, on (also a, on Leg.Gort., v. infr.), = w(rai=os,
ripe, karpo/s Arist.Fr.571; w(ri/mh kriqh/ Sch.Ar.Eq.1233, Eust.1446.29; bo/trues, opp. o)/mfakes, AP9.316 (Leon.); o)pw/ra D.S.17.67:
timely, in season, of fish, Nicom.Com.1.21: c. inf., tou= u(pa/rxonto/s moi klh/rou . . w(ri/mou sparh=nai PTeb.54.7 (i B. C.); kairo\s w(rimw/tatos ei)/s ti Gp.9.9.7.
marriageable, fem. w(ri/ma Leg.Gort.8.39. to\ w(/rimon
bloom, seu to\ w(/. te/frh ka/yei Herod.1.38.

w(ri^m-o/ths, htos, h(,
ripeness, seasonableness, Sch.D Il.19.119.

w(rio/karpos, on,
with ripe or
timely fruit, Orph.H.56.11.
w)/rion, Adv., Ion. for au)/rion, Gramm.post Greg.Cor.p.698S.

w(/rios (A), a, on, Pi.P.9.98; also os, on AP7.188 (Thall.), 9.311 (Phil.), Opp.H.1.689:—poet. form of w(rai=os,
produced in season, w(/ria pa/nta all
the fruits of the season, Od.9.131, Theoc.7.62, cf. Hes. Op.394, Theoc.15.112, AP9.329 (Leon.). generally,
in due season, seasonable, e)/rga Hes.Op.392, 422; ga/mos ib.697; w)di/s Opp. l.c., cf. AP9.311 (Phil.); xro/nos w(/. h(mi=n ib.10.100 (Antiphan.); plo/os kw/pais w(/. Arat.154; w(/rion (sc. e)sti/) c. inf.,
it is time . . , Sol.27.9 (s. v. l.).
youthful, a)/nqos Epigr.Gr.319 (Philadelphia);
fresh, w(/rion oi(=a/ te mh=lon ktl. Archyt.Amphiss.2 ( = Euph.11). w(/ria, ta/,
the season, no/son w(/ria ti/ktei BionFr.15.13.—This poet. form is also used in late Prose, to\ w(/. th=s a)kmh=s Hld.10.9; ta\ w(/. D.L.2.139, cf. Him.Or.3.5. Adv. -ws Anon. ap. Suid.; but neut. sg. used as Adv., Arat.1076. qaya/twsan kai\ ta\ w(/. au)tou=, kaqw\s e)/qos e)sti/n, au)toi\ poihsa/twsan his
funeral rites, IG9(1).39, cf. 42 (Phocis, ii B. C.).

w)/rios (B), on, (w)=ros,
sleep)
nightly, xoro/s cj. Brunck in Mesom. Sol.22, where xro/non w(/rion codd., fort. recte.
w)/rios (C), Dor., = ou)/rios, v.l. (ap.Sch.) in Theoc.7.62, cj. in Hippod. ap. Stob.4.39.26.
w)/risma, atos, to/, f.l. for o)a/risma in Opp.C.4.23.
w)/ristos or w(/ristos, Ion. crasis for o( a)/ristos, Il.11.288, al.

w(ri/ths [i_], ou, o(,
ruler of the Seasons, of Apollo, Lyc.352; *)apo/llwnos *)wrei/ton (sic) Anecd.Stud.267.

*)wri/wn, wnos, o(,
Orion, Od.5.121, 11.310, 572, Telesarch. ap. S.E. M.1.262, Str.9.2.12, etc. the
constellation named after him, Il.18.486,488, 22.29, Od.5.274, Hes.Op.598, 609, Arist. Mete.361b23, Pr.941b24. a fabulous Indian bird, Str.15.1.69, Ael.NA17.22, Nonn.D.26.202. [i_ in Hom.; i^ Att., E.Ion 1153, Cyc.213, v. Choerob. in Theod.1.272 H.: we also find *)wa^ri/wn in Corinn.2, Supp.2.77, Call.Dian.265, and in Pi.N.2.12 (v.l. o)ari/wna); Adj. *)wariw/neios, a, on, fu/sis Id.I.4(3).49(67); the Homeric *)wri_wn arose by contraction of *)wa- and metrical lengthening of i.]
w(rme/a^tai, w(rme/a^to, v. o(rma/w.
w)/rnuen, w)/rnu^to, v. o)/rnumi.

w(ro-genh/s, e/s, in pl., oi( w(. qeoi/ gods (planets)
who preside over the several hours of the day, PMag.Leid.W.1.30, cf. 9.37.

w(ro-gnwmone/w,
tell the hour, Dam.Isid.100.

w(ro-gra^fi/ai, ai(,
annals, D.S.1.26; cf. w(=ros (C) 11.

w(ro-gra/fos [a^], o(,
writing history by seasons or
years, annalist, Plu.2.869a; also
précis=writer (or perh.
postmaster), POxy. 710 (ii B. C.).

w(ro/-desmos, o(,
straw rope for binding sheaves, Eust. 1162.32.
w(ro-drome/w, = w(roskope/w, of a sign, Tz.H.1.476.

w(ro-dro/mhma, atos, to/,
space traversed in an hour, Cat.Cod.Astr.1.23.

w(ro-qete/w,
take note of a thing
in casting a nativity, to\n *)/arh kai\ to\n *kro/non AP 11.160 (Lucill.).
to be in the ascendant at the natal hour, of one's ruling planet, w(roqetei= se *kro/nos ib.161 (Id.).

w(ro-kra/twr, oros, o(,
the lord of the hour, Ps.-Ptol.Centil.90.

w(rolog-e/w,
tell of the *(=wrai, Eust. 1349.9; cf. sq.

w(rolog-hth/s, ou=, o(,
one that tells of the *(=wrai (or possibly
reaps profit from . .), laba/rguros w(., of Prodicus, who composed a speech entitled *(=wrai, Timo 18, cf. Eust.1349.10.

w(rolog-ia/[rxhs], ou, o(,
inspector of clocks, prob. in IGRom. 3.1397 (Bithynia, iii A. D.).

w(rolog-iko/s, h/, o/n,
telling the hour, Eust. ad D.P.223.

w(rolo/g-ion, to/,
an instrument for telling the time, a dial or
clock, w(. skioqhriko/n the sun-
dial of Anaximenes, Plin.HN2.187; a sun-dial (w(rolo/gion) at Zea (Piraeus) mentioned in PHaw.81 (Att. periegesis of iii B. C., pap. of ii A. D.); a)po\ tou= skiakou= w(rologi/ou IGRom.4.293ai35 (Pergam., prob. 127/6 B.C.), cf. Cleom.1.10sq., Gem.8.23, Plu.2.1006f, CIG1947 (loc. inc.), Inscr.Cos57, Suid. (who writes it w(rologei=on）; w(. u(drauliko/n a water-
clock, = kleyu/dra, cf. Aristocl. ap.Ath.4.174c, Plin.HN7.213, Bato 2.14; mhxanika\ w(. Ach.Tat. Intr.Arat.25.6: the dimensions of a water(?)-clock are given in POxy.470.31 (iii A. D.).

w(ro/log-os (parox.), o(,
an Egyptian astrologer, Chaerem. ap. Porph.Abst.4.8.

w(ro/-mantis, ews, o(,
the hour-prophet, of the cock, prob. in Babr. 124.15 (w(roma/thn cod. Vat., w(rono/mon Suid. s.v. pe/tanra).

w(ro-me/dwn, ontos, o(,
ruling the seasons, of Phoebus, IG12(5).893 (Tenos, ii/iii A. D.), Epigr.Gr.1036.2 (Bithynia).
w(ronom-ei=on or w(ronom-no/mion, to/, = w(rolo/gion, Alex.Aphr.Pr.1.95, Hld. 9.22.
w(ronom-eu/s, h=os, o(, = w(rono/mos 11, Antioch.Astr. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 1.108.
w(ronom-eu/w, poet. for sq., Man.4.593, Doroth. ap. Heph.Astr. 3.30.

w(ronom-e/w,
to be in the ascendant, Man.1.58,339: c. acc., *kro/nos w(ronomei= tetrapo/dwn ge/nesin AP11.383 (Pall.).

that, in order that; in this sense w(s and w(s a)/n, Ep. w(/s ken, are used with the subj. after primary tenses of the indic., and with the opt. after the past tenses, boulh\n u(poqhso/meq' . . , w(s mh\ pa/ntes o)/lwntai Il.8.37; tu/mbon xeu/amen . . , w(/s ken thlefanh\s . . ei)/h Od. 24.83; h(mei=s d' i)/wmen w(s, o(phni/k' a)\n qeo\s plou=n h(mi\n ei)/kh|, thnikauq' o(rmw/meqa S.Ph.464; [ne/as] dihkosi/as perie/pempon . . w(s a)\n mh\ o)fqei/hsan Hdt.8.7. b. rarely c. fut. indic., w(s mh\ w)=n au)toi\ te a)pole/esqe (cj. Cobet for a)po/lesqe） ka)me\ trw/sete, e)s a)/llon tina\ dh=mon a)poi/xesqe Hecat. 30J. w(s is also used with past tenses of the indic. to express a purpose which has not been or cannot be fulfilled, ti/ m' ou)k e)/kteinas, w(s e)/deica mh/pote . . ;

should . . , S.OT1392; e)/dei ta\ e)ne/xura labei=n, w(s mhd' ei) e)bou/leto e)du/nato e)capata=n X.An. 7.6.23; cf. i(/na B. 1.3, o(/pws B. 1.3. w(s c. inf., to limit an assertion, w(s me\n e)moi\ doke/ein Hdt.6.95, cf. 2.124; w(s ei)pei=n lo/gw| ib.53; or w(s e)/pos ei)pei=n, cf. e)/pos 11.4; w(s sunto/mws, or w(s sunelo/nti ei)pei=n

S.Tr.590, X.HG4.1.33. h)\ w(s after a Comp., ma/sson' h)\ w(s i)de/men Pi.O.13.113; malakw/teroi . . h)\ w(s ka/llion au)toi=s Pl.R. 410d; cf. w(/ste B. 1.2: with words implying comparison, o)li/goi e)sme\n w(s e)gkratei=s ei)=nai au)tw=n too few
to . . , X.Cyr.4.5.15, grau=s ei)=, w)= *)elpini/kh, w(s thlikau=ta diapra/ttesqai pra/gmata too old

inasmuch as, since, ti/ pote le/geis, w)= te/knon; w(s ou) manqa/nw S.Ph.914, cf. E.Ph.843, 1077, Ar.Ra.278: c. opt., mh\ kai\ la/qh| me prospesw/n: w(s ma=llon a)\n e(/loito m' h)\ tou\s pa/ntas *)argei/ous labei=n S.Ph.46.

G); a)ganaktou=sin w(s mega/lwn tinw=n a)pesterhme/noi (i. e. h(gou/menoi mega/lwn tinw=n a)pesterh=sqai), Pl.R.329a: most freq. c. part. fut., diabai/nei . . , w(s a)mh/swn to\n si=ton Hdt.6.28, cf. 91; pareskeua/zonto w(s polemh/sontes Th.2.7, etc.; dhloi=s w(/s ti shmanw=n ne/on S.Ant. 242; w(s teqnh/cwn i)/sqi nuni/ Ar.Ach.325 (troch.): in questions, para\ *prwtago/ran nu=n e)pixeirei=s i)e/nai, w(s para\ ti/na a)fico/menos; Pl.Prt.311b; w(s ti/ dh\ qe/lwn; E.IT557; with vbs. of knowing, e)pista/sqw *kroi=sos w(s u(/steron . . a(lou\s th=s peprwme/nhs Hdt.1.91; w(s mh\ 'mpolh/swn i)/sqi . . Hdt.5.85, 9.54; nu=n de/ sou ta\ e)/rga fanera\ gege/nhtai ou)x w(s a)niwme/nou a)ll' w(s h(dome/nou toi=s gignome/nois Lys.12.32; ktu/pos fwto\s w(s teirome/nou <tou> S.Ph.202 (lyr.); e)n o)ligwri/a| e)poiou=nto, w(s, o(/tan e)ce/lqwsin, h)\ ou)x u(pomenou=ntas sfa=s h)\ r(a|di/ws lhyo/menoi bi/a| made light of the matter,
in the belief that . . , Th.4.5.—Both constructions in one sentence, tou\s ko/smous ei)/ase xai/rein w(s a)llotri/ous te o)/ntas kai\ ple/on qa/teron h(ghsa/menos a)perga/zesqai Pl.Phd.114e, cf. X.Cyr.1.5.9. with Parts. put abs. in gen., nu=n de/, w(s ou(/tw e)xo/ntwn, stratih\n e)kpe/mpete Hdt.8.144; e)rw/ta o(/ti bou/lei, w(s ta)lhqh= e)rou=ntos X.Cyr.3.1.9; w(s w(=d' e)xo/ntwn tw=nd' e)pi/stasqai/ se xrh/ S.Aj.281, cf. 904, A.Pr.760, E.Med.1311, Th.7.15, X.An.1.3.6: so also in acc., misqo\n ai)tou=sin, w(s ou)xi\ au)toi=sin w)feli/an e)some/nhn e)k tou= a)/rxein Pl.R.345e, cf. E.Ph.1461: with both cases in one sentence, w(s kai\ tw=n *)aqhnai/wn prosdoki/mwn o)/ntwn a)/llh| stratia=| kai\ . . diapepolemhso/menon Th.7.25, cf. Pl.R.604b. w(s before Preps., a)nh/gonto w(s e)pi\ naumaxi/an (v.l. -i/a|) Th.1.48, cf. X. HG2.1.22; fru/gana sulle/gontes w(s e)pi\ pu=r Id.An.4.3.11; kate/labe th\n a)kro/polin w(s e)pi\ turanni/di, expressing the purpose, Th.1.126; a)pe/pleon . . w(s e)s ta\s *)aqh/nas Id.6.61; plei=s w(s pro\s oi)=kon S.Ph.58; to\ bou/leum' w(s e)p' *)argei/ois to/d' h)=n Id.Aj.44: in these passages w(s marks an intention; not so in the following: a)pagge/llete th=| mhtri\ [xai/rein] w(s par' e)mou= X.Cyr.8.7.28; also w(s a)po\ th=s pomph=s Pl.R. 327c; w(s e)k kakw=n e)xa/rh Hdt.8.101. later, in geographical expressions, of direction, proi+w/n, w(s e)pi\ to\n *phneio/n Str.9.5.8, cf. 13.1.22; w(s pro\s e(/w ble/pwn Id.8.6.1, cf. 7.6.2; w(s ei)s *fhrai/an (leg. *(hrai/an） i)o/ntwn Id.8.3.32. w(s as a Prep., prop. in cases where the object is a person, not a place: once in Hom., w(s ai)ei\ to\n o(moi=on a)/gei qeo\s w(s to\n o(moi=on Od.17.218 (v.l. e)s to\n o(moi=on, cf. ai)=nos *(omhriko/s, ai)e\n o(moi=on w(s qeo/s . . e)s to\n o(moi=on a)/gei Call.Aet.1.1.10; e)/rxetai . . e(/kaston to\ o(/moion w(s to\ o(/., to\ pukno\n w(s to\ pukno/n ktl. (with v.l. e)s) Hp.Nat.Puer.17), but possibly w(s . . w(/s
as . . so, in Od. l.c.; also in Hdt., e)selqei=n w(s th\n qugate/ra 2.121.e/: freq. in Att., w(s *)=agin e)presbeu/santo Th.8.5, etc.; a)fi/keto w(s *perdi/kkan kai\ e)s th\n *xalkidikh/n Id.4.79; a)pe/pleusan e)s *fw/kaian . . w(s *)astu/oxon Id.8.31; nau=s e)s to\n *(ellh/sponton w(s *farna/bazon a)pope/mpein ib.39; w(s e)kei=non ple/omen w(/sper pro\s despo/thn Isoc. 4.121; the examples of w(s with names of places are corrupt, e.g. w(s th\n *mi/lhton Th.8.36 (e)s cod. Vat.); w(s *)/abudon one Ms. in Id.8.103; w(s to\ pro/sqen Ar.Ach.242: in S.OT1481 w(s ta\s a)delfa\s . . ta\s e)ma\s xe/ras is equiv. to w(s e)me\ to\n a)delfo/n; in Id.Tr.366 do/mous w(s tou/sde house = household. w(s in independent sentences: as an exclamation,

w(siwme/nws, Adv. part. pf. Pass. of o(sio/w, = o(si/ws, Poll.1.32.

w)s-mh/, h(,
thrust, attack, P.Bremen 1.4 (ii A. D.).
w)s-mo/s, o(, 'Hellenic' for the Att. forms w)stismo/s and w)qismo/s, D.S.2.19, Moer. p.424 P.

w(/sper, or w(/s per, Adv. of Manner,
like as, even as, zh=n w(/. h)/dh zh=|s S.Ph.1396; e)sw/|zet' a)\n . . , w(/. ou)xi\ sw/|zetai Id.El.994; but the Verb is more often left to be supplied, ou)/ ti katakru/ptousin . . , w(/. *ku/klwpes Od.7.206, cf. 2.333, Il.4.263, 14.50; e)/cesti/ q', w(/. *(hge/loxos, h(mi=n le/gein . . Ar.Ra.303; tetagme/noi w(/. e)/mellon Th.4.93; toi=s h)tuxhko/sin w(/. e)gw/ D.45.1; Hom. freq. puts a word between w(s and per, e.g. w(s su/ per au)th/, w(s to\ pa/ros per, w(s e)/setai/ per Od.19.385, Il.5.806, 1.211;
as for instance, o(/tan xoro\s . . gi/gnhtai, w(/. <o(> ei)s *h=lon pempo/menos X.Mem.3.3.12; w(/sper differs from w(s in Hom., in that it seldom has an antecedent expressed, as in Il.24.487, thli/kou w(/. e)gw/n; also in Hes.Th.402, w(\s d' au)/tws . . , w(/. u(pe/sth; but in Trag. and Att. w(/. is very freq. after demonstr. words; before ou(/tws, Meliss.3, Ar.Av.188; after it, S.Tr.475, etc.; w(/. kai\ . . , ou(/tw kai\ . . X.Cyr.7.5.75, cf. Pl.R.354b; w(/ . . , w(=de . . S.OT276; toiou=tos w(/. Pl.Prt.327d; au)tou= w(/. ei)=xon
just as they were,
then and there, Hdt. 2.121.d/, cf. S.Ant.1235; eu)qu\s w(/. ei)=xen X.An.4.1.19; eu)qu\s w(/. e)/tuxe Id.HG3.1.19; ta\n tra/pezan ka/tqete w(/. e)/xei Sophr. in PSI11.1214a2; kai\ to\n daelo\n sbh=te w(/. e)/xei
on the spot, ib.14: c. gen., w(/. e)/xei do/chs Pl.R.612d: strengthd., w(/. ge
just exactly as, Ar.Nu.673; w(/. kai/
even as, w(s kai\ e)gw/ per Il.6.477; w(/. kai\ a)/llo ti Th.1.142, etc.: w(/. also follows i)/sos, in Od.20.282, moi=ran . . i)/shn, w(s au)toi/ per e)la/gxanon, cf. S.El.533; so after o( au)to/s, Pl.Phd.86a, D.9.33; after o(/moios, o(/moios a)tmo\s w(/. e)k ta/fou pre/pei A.Ag.1311, cf. Th.4.34. w(/sper a)/n c. subj., v. infr.111; c. opt., w(/sper a)/n tis . . le/goi Pl.Phd. 87b, cf. X.HG3.1.14; cf. w(sperei/ 11. to limit or modify an assertion or apologize for a metaphor,
as it were, so to speak, w(/. a)koniti/ Th.4.73; to\n e)gke/falon w(/. sesei=sqai/ moi dokei=s Ar.Nu. 1276, cf. Pax234; a(/ma me\n . . w(/. u(pefqo/nei X.Cyr.4.1.13, cf. Pl.Phdr. 270d, Cra.384c; in later Gk. sts. after the word to which it refers, e)sfigme/non w(/. Porph.Chr.26; ba/qron w(/. Sch.Pi.O.8.33; ste/fanos w(/. tw=n po/lewn ta\ tei/xh ib.42: freq. with parts., w(/. e)ggelw=sa S.El. 277; w(/. e)ntetame/nou tou= sw/matos Pl.Phd.86b; w(/. ti tw=n a)/llwn eu)lo/gws pepoihko/tes
as if they had done, Lys.12.7; w(/. e)co/n
as if it were in our power, X.An.3.1.14; siwph=| e)dei/pnoun, w(/. tou=to e)pitetagme/non au)toi=s Id.Smp.1.11, cf. Mem.2.3.3; with a change of construction, w(/. to\n a)riqmo\n tou=ton e)/xonta a)na/gkhn . . , kai\ ou)/te . . oi(=o/n te ei)/h gene/sqai Id.HG2.3.19; th\n w(/. e)pi\ tou= di/frou e(/dran a seat
like that used in the chariot, Id.Eq.7.5. rarely of Time, w(/sper a)/n = e(/ws a)/n,
so long as, or
however long (cf. w(s Ad. 2), w(/sper a)\n zw= S.OC1361 (sed leg. e(/wsper).
as soon as, Ar.Pax24. after a Comp. (cf. w(s Ab. 1.4); ou) mei/ous w(/. xi/lioi Xenoph.3.4; h(=tton . . w(/. X.HG2.3.16.—Cf. w(sperei/, w(/sper ou)=n.
w)/sper, for w(/sper, barbarism in Ar.Th.1185, 1192.

w(spera/n,
about, w(. penth/konta podw=n D.H.1.15.

w(sperei/ or w(/sper ei), Adv.
just as if, with indic., w(/sper ei) paresta/teis A.Ag.1201; with opt., w(/sper tis ei)/ soi . . mhde\n didoi/h S.OC 776; to\ "w(sperei\" fa/nai to say '
as it were', Longin.32.3; o(/moia w(/. ei) . . X.Smp.4.37: with Nouns or parts.,
as it were, w(. yh=ttan Ar. Lys.115; w(. prokei/menon Id.Ec.537; a(\ w(. stoixei=a tw=n a)/llwn e)sti/ Pl.Cra.422a. w(/sper a)\n ei) or w(speranei/ (prop. elliptical for w(/sper a)\n h)=n, ei) . . , or the like ), Id.Grg.479a, Prt.311b, Isoc.4.148, X.Cyr.1.3.2; Dor. w(/sper ai)k e)c e(no\s keleu/matos kexa/nanti they gape
as it were 'by numbers' Sophr.25; w(/sper ou)=n a)\n ei) with impf., Pl.R.420c: cf. w(/sper 1.2.

w(sperou)=n or w(/sper ou)=n, Adv.
even as, w(/. ou)=n a)pw/leto A.Ch.96, cf. 888, Ag.1171.
as indeed, as in fact, ei) d' e)/stin （w(/sper ou)=n e)/sti） qeo/s Pl.Phdr.242e, cf. Ap.21d.

w(/ste, as Adv., bearing the same relation to w(s as o(/ste to o(/s, and used by Hom. more freq. than w(s in similes, when it is commonly written divisim, and is relat. to a demonstr. w(/s: sts. c. pres. Indic., Il.2.459 sq., 12.421, 13.703: sts. c. aor., w(/s te le/wn e)xa/rh 3.23: sts. c. subj. pres. or aor., 2.474 sq., 11.67, 16.428, Od.22.302: all three usages combined in one simile, with varied construction, Il.5.136-9:—the verb is sts. omitted, la/mf' w(/s te steroph/ 10.154: this usage of w(/ste is chiefly Ep. (Pi. uses w(=te, q. v.), but it occurs in Alc.(?)27 (prob.), B.12.124 and sts. in Trag., katw/ruxes d' e)/naion w(/st' a)h/suroi mu/rmhkes A.Pr.452, cf. Th.62, Pers. 424, Ch.421 (lyr.), S.OC343, Ant.1033, Tr.112 (lyr.). to mark the power or virtue by which one does a thing,
as being, inasmuch as, like a(/te, to\n d' e)ch/rpac' *)afrodi/th r(ei=a ma/l', w(/. qeo/s Il.3.381, cf. 18.518; w(/. peri\ yuxh=s
since it was for life, Od.9.423; w(/. tau=ta nomi/zwn Hdt.1.8, cf. 5.83, 101, 6.94. as Conj. to express
the actual or
intended result of the action in the principal clause: mostly c. inf.,
so as or
for to do a thing, twice in Hom., ei) de/ soi qumo\s e)pe/ssutai, w(/. ne/esqai if thy heart is eager
to return, Il.9.42; ou) thli/kos . . , w(/. shma/ntori pa/nta piqe/sqai not of such age
as to obey a master in all things, Od.17.21; r(hi+di/ws ken e)rga/ssaio, w(/. se kei)s e)niauto\n e)/xein Hes.Op.44; w(/. a)poplhsqh=nai （a)poplh=sai codd.) to\n xrhsmo/n Hdt.8.96: freq. in Pi., O.9.74, N.5.1, 35, al.; also in Trag. and Att. after demonstratives, ou)/pw tosou=ton h)pathme/nos kurw= w(/st' a)/lla xrh/|zein S.OT595, etc.; this constr. is found in cases where (as in Il.9.42 supr. cit.) w(/ste seems superfluous; so after e)qe/lein, *ku/pris . . h)/qel' w(/. gi/gnesqai to/de E.Hipp.1327; after e)/sti, for e)/cesti, S.Ph.656; after yhfi/zesqai, Th.5.17; after e)pai/rein, E.Supp.581; e)paggello/menoi w(/. bohqei=n Th.8.86; after words implying request, dehqe/ntes . . w(/. yhfi/sasqai Id.1.119; pei=sai w(/. sugxwrh=sai Id.8.45. after Comparatives with h)/, when the possibility of the consequence is denied (cf. w(s B. 111.2), me/zw kaka\ h)\ w(/ste a)naklai/ein woes too great for tears, Hdt. 3.14; mei=zon h)\ w(/ste fe/rein du/nasqai kako/n X.Mem.3.5.17: but in Poetry w(/ste is sts. left out, no/shma mei=zon h)\ fe/rein S.OT1293; krei/sson' h)\ fe/rein kaka/ E.Hec.1107 (rarely in Prose, Pl.Tht.149c); similarly with the Posit., yuxro\n w(/. lou/sasqai
too cold
to bathe in, X.Mem.3.13.3; h(mei=s e)/ti ne/oi w(/. diele/sqai
too young
to . . , Pl.Prt. 314b; ge/rwn e)kei=nos w(/. d' w)felei=n parw/n E.Andr.80: this w(/ste is sts. omitted after words implying comparison, o)li/gous ei)=nai stratih=| th=| *mh/dwn sumbale/ein too few . . Hdt.6.109; tapeinh\ h( dia/noia e)gkarterei=n Th.2.61, etc. w(/ste . . a)/n is used with inf., of contingencies more or less improbable, ou(/tws e)ka/eto w(/ste mh/te . . a)/llo ti h)\ gumnoi\ a)ne/xesqai, h(/dista/ te a)\n e)s u(/swr yuxro\n sfa=s au)tou\s r(i/ptein Th.2.49, cf. S.OT374, El.1316, D.8.35. sts. implying
on condition that . . , like e)f' w(=|te, paradou=nai sfa=s au)tou\s *)aqhnai/ois, w(/ste bouleu=sai o(/ ti a)\n e)kei/nois dokh=| Th.4.37, cf. X.An.5.6.26. c. Indic., to express the actual or possible result with emphasis, ou)k ou(/tw frenoblabh\s o( *pri/amos ou)de\ oi( a)/lloi . . , w(/. kinduneu/ein e)bou/lonto Hdt.2.120 (fort. delendum e)bou/lonto）; a)sqene/es ou(/tw, w(/. . . diatetrane/eis Id.3.12; ou(/tws a)gnwmo/nws e)/xete, w(/. e)lpi/zete . . ; are you so foolish
that you expect . . ? D.2.26, be/bhken, w(/. pa=n e)n h(su/xw| e)/cesti fwnei=n S.OC82, cf. OT533: freq. in X., Mem.2.2.3, al.; with a)/n and the impf. or aor. implying a supposed case, w(/st', ei) fronw=n e)/prasson, ou)d' a)\n w(=d' e)gigno/mhn kako/s S.OC271; w(/ste ou)k a)\n e)/laqen
au)to/qen o(rmw/menos Th.5.6: w(/ste th\n po/lin a)\n h(gh/sw pole/mou e)rgasth/rion ei)=nai X.Ages.1.26. at the beginning of a sentence, to mark a strong conclusion,
and so, therefore, w(/st' . . o)/lwla kai/ se prosdiafqerw= S.Ph.75; w(/st' ou)x u(/pnw| g' eu(/donta/ m' e)cegei/rete Id.OT 65; w(/. kai\ tau=ta lexqh/setai Arist.Metaph.1004a22: c. imper., qnhto\s d' *)ore/sths, w(/. mh\ li/an ste/ne S.El.1172; w(/. qa/rrei X.Cyr.1.3.18, cf. Pl.Prt.311a; w(/. a)\n bou/lhsqe xeirotonh/sate D.9.70 cod.A (-h/sete cett.); before a question, w(/. ti/s a)\n a)peto/lmhse . .; Lys.7.28. c. opt., with a)/n, Hdt.2.16; bre/fos ga\r h)=n to/t' . . , w(/st' ou)k a)\n au)to\n gnwri/saim' E.Or.379, cf. S.OT857, Ar.Ach.943 (lyr.). b. c. opt. in orat. obliq., X.HG3.5.23; after opt. in principal clause, Id.Oec.1.13. with subj.,
in order that, in Thessalian dialect, to\s tami/as fronti/sai ou(/ste . . geneiqei= ta= po/li a( do/sis BCH59.38 (Crannon); a)ntillabe/sqai ta=s po/llios (sic) ou(/ste . . e)s pa/ntoun e)gluqei= tou=n danei/oun ib.p.37. with part., instead of inf., after a part. in the principal clause, tosou=ton a(pa/ntwn dienegko/ntes, w(/sq' u(pe\r *)argei/wn dustuxhsa/ntwn *qhbai/ois . . e)pita/ttontes ktl. Isoc.4.64 (s. v.l.); ou(/tw sfo/dra misou=nta tou=ton, w(/ste polu\ dh\ （a)\n Dobree) qa=tton diaqe/menon ktl. Is.9.16; w(/ste . . de/on D.3.1. po/lemos sklhro\s w(/ste li/an
extremely, LXX 2 Ki.2.17. in later Greek, folld. by Preps., *parme/nonti kleido\s w(/. e)pi\ to\ *dioskou/rion Inscr.Délos316.83 (iii B. C.); cu/lon w(/. e)pi\ th\n a(/macan IG11(2)287 A52 (iii B. C.); mo/lubdos w(/. ei)s to\ *ku/nqion ib.203A52 (iii B. C.); kriqw=n w(/. ei)s ta\ kth/nh barley
for the animals, PCair.Zen.251.5 (iii B. C.); w(/. ei)s ce/nia foi/nikas PHal.1.7.4 (iii B. C.). c. dat.,
for, xrei/a au)tou= e)sti\n w(/. *pisiklei= it is needed
for P., PCair.Zen.241 (iii B. C.); w(/. toi=s xhsi/n IG11(2).287A45 (iii B. C.).

w)s-te/on, (w)qe/w)
one must thrust out, D.Chr.70.8.

w)/s-ths, ou, o(,
one who thrusts or
pushes; seismo\s w)/. an earthquake
with one violent shock, Arist.Mu.396a8(pl.).

w)s-ti/zomai, fut. Att. w)stiou=mai Ar. Ach.24:—Pass., Frequentat. of w)qe/omai,
to push and be pushed about, mostly c. dat. pers.,
to jostle with another,
jostle him
and be jostled by him, w)stiei= *kleonu/mw| Ar.Ach.844; dou/laisin w)stizome/nh Id.Lys.330(lyr.); w)stiou=ntai . . a)llh/loisi peri\ prw/tou cu/lou Id.Ach. 24: abs., e)s th\n proedri/an pa=s a)nh\r w)sti/zetai
jostles for the first seat, ib.42, cf. Pl.330; so, Comically, tw=n . . plakou/ntwn w)stizome/nwn peri\ th\n gna/qon TeleclId.1.13.

w)s-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
inclined to thrust, pushing, w)stikh\ . . h( tou= pneu/matos fu/sis Arist.MA703a23; to\ w).
impetuosity, Arr.Epict.4.1.84. Adv. -kw=s ib.2.9.5, M.Ant.9.3.
w)s-tismo/s, o(, = w)qismo/s, Moer.p.424P.
w)s-to/s, h/, o/n, （w)qe/w） w)sto/n: to\ a)podi/wkton, Hdn.Epim.103.
w)/sxh, h(, = klhmati/s, EM825.2, cf. Procl. ap. Phot.p.322B., Suid.

w)sxo/s, o(, in pl. w)sxoi/: ta\ ne/a klh/mata su\n au)toi=s toi=s bo/trusin, Hsch., cf. AB318: sg., Aristodem. ap. Ath.11.495f, cf. oi)sxo/s: klh=ma bo/truas fe/ron o)rgw=ntas kai\ gennai/ous, kai\ o)sxofo/ria (v. sq.), ta\ th=s a)mpe/lou klh/mata perie/xonta bo/truas, para\ *)aristofa/nei, EM619.32 (v. infr.), whence Brunck conjectured o)/sxon for the Aldine reading o)/rxon in Ar.Ach.997, where codd. and Sch. have the unmetrical kla/don (one Ms. ka/don); perh. w)sxo/n shd. be read, as the w)- is corroborated by EM824.55, and by w)sxofo/ria, etc.:—o)/sxoi, the reading adopted by Littré from three codd. in Hp.Mul.2.204, gives a poorer sense than o)/xoi (v. o)/xos 11.2), the reading of many good Mss. (incl. Vind. q) : o)/sxos in Sch.Od.5.38 is apparently f.l. for o)sxeo/s, cf. Sch.A Il.24.94. [The w)- of this and the foll. words, for which o)- is an occasional v. l., is found in the best codd. and is corroborated by the position of the word in the ancient lexica.]

w)sxo-fore/w,
celebrate the w)sxofo/ria, Phot.

w)sxo-fo/ria, ta/, one day of the Athen. festival *ski/ra, on which two chosen young men, sons of citizens, in women's dress,
carrying vine-shoots loaded with grapes (v. w)sxo/s), went in procession from the temple of Dionysus to that of *)aqhna= *skira/s, Philoch.44, Plu.Thes.22, Alciphr.1.4, 3.1. sg. w)sxo-fo/rion, to/, the sanctuary of Athena *skira/s in Phalerum, Hsch., AB318, etc.

w)sxo-foriko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for the w)sxofo/ria, Ath.14.631b; me/lh w). Poll.4.53, Procl. ap. Phot. p.322B.

w)sxo-fo/roi, oi(,
the young men who carried the vine-branches, Hyp.Fr.87, Philoch.44, and Ister 13, all ap.Harp. (o)sxo-).
w)ta^ki/s, i/dos, h(, a sea-plant, Dionys.Av.2.7.

w)ta^koust-e/w,
listen, eavesdrop, Hdt.8.130, X.Cyr.5.3.56, 8.2.10, D.19.288; w). kai\ katopteu/ein ta\ sumbai/nonta Plb.31.13.1: c. gen., Suid.

w)ta^koust-h/s, ou=, o(,
listener, eavesdropper, of a person employed as
a spy by tyrants, Arist.Pol.1313b14, Mu.398a21, Plb.16.37.1, Plu. 2.522f.

w)talg-e/w,
have the ear-ache, Dsc.4.64.
w)talg-ia/w, = w)talge/w, Dsc.2.169.

w)talg-iko/s, h/, o/n,
suffering from ear-ache, v. l. in Id.4.64.

w)tara=s, =
auriculosus, Gloss.

w)ta/rion [a^], to/, Dim. of ou)=s,
a little ear, Anaxandr.43; w)ta/ri' u(/eia Alex.110.16; later simply = ou)=s, AP11.75 (Lucill.); Ev.Jo.18.10. metaph.,
handle of a vessel, Parth. ap. Ath.11.783c; w)ta/ria ka/dou IG7.3498.18 (Oropus, iii B. C.), cf. BGU781i15, Inscr.Délos 421.54 (ii B. C.). the
ormer or
Haliotis, Ath.3.87f.

w(/te, Dor. for w(/ste A.1, Pi.N.6.28, 7.62, I.4(3).18(36), O.10(11).86, P.10.54, Alcm.23.41, B.16.105, Corinn.Supp.2.65, Lyr.Adesp.ap. A.D.Pron.48.28. (For the accent, cf. Wackernagel
Beitr.z.Lehre vom Gr.Akzent p.20; w(=te: su\n tw=| i_, a)nti\ tou= w(seite, Choerob. in An.Ox.2.281; this spelling (w(/|te, w(/ite) is found in Alcm. and cod. A of A. D. l. c., Corinn. l. c.)

w)tegxu/ths [u^], ou, o(,
ear-syringe, Dsc.Eup.1.56, Gal.6.439, Hermes38.284.

w)teil-h/, h(,
wound, esp.
a fresh, open wound, Il. (acc. to Ammon. Diff.pp.104,144, opp. ou)lh/）; dei=cen . . ai(=ma katarre/on e)c w)teilh=s Il.5.870; ai(=m' e)/ti qermo\n a)nh/noqen e)cw). 11.266, cf. 17.297; do/ru xa/lkeon e)cw). ei)/ruse 16.862; w)teilh\n . . dh=san e)pistame/nws Od.19.456;—Aristarch. considered w)teilh/ as restricted in Hom. to a
wound inflicted hand to hand, not by a missile, xalkotu/pous w). Il.19.25, and therefore he rejected as spurious 4.140, 149, cf. Sch.Il.4.140, 11.266, 18.351. after Hom. (esp. in Hp.) generally,
wound, whether recent or not, ki/ndunos a)\n ei)/h surragh=nai ta\s w). Hp.Art.11; also,
the mark of a wound, scar, o(/tan ta\ e(/lkea e)s w)teila\s i)/h| ibid., cf. Ruf.
Ren.Ves. Praef.:
ulcer, Gal.19.157:—once in X., ta\ me\n e)/paqen, w(=n ta\s w)teila\s [fanera\s add. codd. plerique] ei)=xen An.1.9.6, cf. Plu.Cor. 14, 2.276d, Jul.Caes.309c. (Prob. fr. ou)ta/w (so Sch.A Il.14.518); cf. ou)tame/nh w)teilh/ Il.14.518, 17.86; Aeol. o)te/lla (sic) Jo.Gramm. Comp. (in Hoffmann
Die griechischen Dialekteii.488); cf. gateilai/ (for vat-) and bwt [e]a/zein).)

w)teil-h=qen, Adv.
from or
out of the wound, Orph.L.653.

w)teil-o/omai, Pass.,
cicatrize, Hp.Fract.27.

w)tiko/s, h/, o/n, (ou)=s)
of or
for the ear, i)atro/s Gal.Thras.24; flegmonai/ Dsc.1.26.

w)ti/on, to/, prop. Dim. of ou)=s,
auricle, Dsc.Eup.1.63, cf. 62; but usu. = ou)=s, AP11.81 (Lucill.), LXX 1 Ki.9.15, al., Ev.Matt.26.51, Arr. Epict.1.18.18, PMag.Osl.1.332. metaph.,
a little handle, proxu/tou Hero Spir.1.9; xwri\s w)ti/wn poth/rion Theopomp.Com.31, cf. Aët.1.138. = w)ta/rion 111, Xenocr. ap. Orib.2.58.130; gloss on th/qh, = lepa\s a)gri/a, Sch.Nic.Al.396.
w)tiofo/ros, o(, = w)toka/tacis, AB287 (where the word is distd. fr. o)tiafo/ros, q. v.): also w)tiafo/ros, EM826.27.

w)ti/s, i/dos, h(, (ou)=s)
bustard, Otis tarda, X.An.1.5.2sq., Arist.HA 509a4, al., Ael.NA5.24, Opp.C.2.407; cf. ou)ti/s, o)ti/s. muo\s w)ti/s, v. muoswti/s.

w)to-glu^fi/s, idos, h(,
ear-pick Pl.Com.148, Hermes38.248, Gp.4.7.1; also w)to/-glu^fon, to/,
Gloss.:—Dim. w)to-glu/fion, to/, ib.

w)to-eidh/s, e/s,
like an ear, ear-shaped, Ruf.Anat.32. Adv. -dw=s ibid.
w)to-qla^di/as, ou, o(, = w)toka/tacis, D.L.5.67.

w)to-ka/tacis, idos, o(,
a boxer with thick or
'cauliflower' ears, Ar.Fr.98, cf. Poll.2.83, EM826.28, Suid. (w)tokat aci/as is f.l. in Poll.4.144).

w)to-kla^di/as, o(, =
auriflaccus, Gloss.

w)to-kope/w,
stun the ears by talking, Hsch.

w)to-kwfe/w,
to be hard of hearing, Zonar.

w)to-la^bi/s, i/dos, h(,
an instrument for laying hold of the ears, tou\s o)/rxeis . . a)podesmei=n th=| w). Hippiatr. 99.

w)to/-liknos, on,
with ears as large as a winnowing-fan; oi( *)wto/liknoi, name of a fabulous Indian tribe, Tz.H.7.635.

w)to-pa/roxos, on, (pare/xw)
supplying or
having ears, Gloss.

w)to-pe/ths, es, =
auritus, ib.

w)to/-rru^tos, on,
having a running from the ears, Hp.Epid.6.1.2.

w)=tos, ou, o( (on the accent v. Hdn.Gr.1.214),
a horned or
eared owl, o( d' w)=tos . . , peri\ ta\ w)=ta pteru/gia e)/xwn Arist.HA597b21, cf. Plu.2.961e, v.l. ib.52b: Ath.9.390d appears to identify it with the w)ti/s, but this is due to interpolation.
an easily deceived person, booby, Com.Adesp.47, Ael.Dion.Fr.336. w)=ta: ta\ mh\ stroggu/la, Hsch.; but w)=toi li/qoi in IG4.823.66 (Troezen) is wrongly read, v. w(= 11.

w)to/tmhtos, on,
with ears slit or
cropped, LXXLe.21.18, 22.23.

w)tw/eis, essa, en, poet. Adj.
with ears or
handles, tri/pous Il.23.264,513, Hes.Op.657. (The older form ou)ato/eis [q. v.] may originally have stood here, but has left no trace in codd.)
w)|u/+fion, to/, Dim. of w)|o/n, Theognost.Can.127; woifia eikosi PLond. 2.335.19 (ii A. D.).

w)fe/l-eia, h(, required by the metre (in iambics), S.El.944, Ar. Th.183; whereas w)feli/a is required in E.Andr.539 (anap.), Fr.78 (lyr.), Ar.Ec.576 (lyr.): the best codd. of Pl. have w)feli/a more freq. than w)fe/leia (although B always has w)fe/leia in Phdr.), and w)feli/a is found in IG12.69.24 (v B. C., Prose), Hyp.Eux.9, and freq. in Phld., as Mus.p.54 K., al.: Ion. w)feli/h Hdt.5.98, al., AP6.187 (Alph.):—
help, aid, succour, esp. in war, e)/pempon e)s th\n *)epi/damnon . . th\n w). Th. 1.26, cf. 39; th\n w). pare/xein tini/ Id.3.13, cf. And.3.31; w). a)ndri\ fe/rein E.Fr.78 (lyr.); w). proslh/yesqai Th.2.7; a)po/ tinwn eu(ri/skesqai Id.1.31; th=s w). metalamba/nein Id.1.39; tugxa/nein Id.6.17; e)pa/gesqai/ tinas e)p' w)feli/a| for
aid, Id.1.3, cf. 5.38; a)poxrh/sasqai th=| e(kate/rou h(mw=n w). to make full use of the
assistance or
services we both can give, Id.6.17; meta\ tw=n keime/nwn no/mwn w)feli/as Id.3.82, cf. D.H. Th.31; ou)de\n i)atrikh=s dei=tai ou)d' w)feli/as or
any other aid, Pl.Ly. 217a, cf. R.559b; kai\ toi=sin e(lkwqei=sin w)feli/an （w)fe/leian codd., unmetrically) e)/xei Com.Adesp.106.8.
profit, advantage, bou/leuma a)p' ou(= . . ou)demi/a e)/melle w)feli/h e)/sesqai Hdt. l. c.; ei)/ tis w)fe/leia/ ge S.El.944; th\n koinh\n w). fula/cai the common
interest of all, Th. 6.80; ti/s a)\n ei)/h h(mi=n w). ei)do/sin au)to/; Pl.Chrm.167b; opp. bla/bh, X.Cyr.6.2.13, Pl. (v. infr.2), etc.; opp. zhmi/a, X.Mem.2.3.6; e)p' w)felei/a| e)sti/ ti ib.1.4.4: c. gen. subjecti, th\n w). th\n tw=n teixe/wn their
utility, Hdt.7.139: c. gen. objecti, e)p' w)feli/a| tw=n fi/lwn for their
benefit, Pl.R.334b; w)feli/as e(/neka ib.398b; e)nanti/a th=| e(autw=n w). And.2.2; e)n w). e)sti/ 'tis
of use, X.Vect.4.35; after w)felei=n, cf. w)fele/w 1.5.
source of gain or
profit, service, freq. in pl., ta\s w). ta\s e)k th=s stratei/as . . e)some/nas Isoc.4.15; ai( koinai\ w). Lys. 19.62; ai( a)po\ tinos gigno/menai w). Isoc.4.29; w)feli/as te kai\ bla/bas a)podidou=sa Id.R.332d; ai( para\ tw=n misqodotou/ntwn au)tou\s w). D.15.32. esp.
gain made in war, spoil, booty, Plb.2.3.8, 3.82.8, Rev.Arch.6(1935).31 (pl., Amphipolis), LXX 2 Ma.8.20; w). mega/lai kai\
la/fura Plu.2.255b; w)felei/as a)qroi=sai Id.Cleom.12; pollh=s w). kurieu=sai D.S.15.36; th\n xw/ran ge/mein w)felei/as Plb.3.80.3; ti/qesqai ta\ xrh/mata di' w)felei/as to regard as
booty, D.H.7.37; so in the chase,
game, X.Cyn.6.4; so of a thief, w). e(toi/mhn kai\ kateirgasme/nhn a)fh=ken Antipho 2.1.4. (Prob. abstracted fr. oi)k-wfeli/a, which comes fr. oi)=kon o)fe/llein 'to
increase the oi)=kos'; cf. o)/felos.）

w)fel-e/w, fut. -h/sw Ar.Av.358, etc.: aor. w)fe/lhsa Hdt.3.127, etc.: pf. -hka Hp. Acut.44, Pl.Grg.511e, etc.: plpf. w)felh/kh Id.Ap.31d:—Pass., fut. w)felhqh/somai And.2.22, Is.10.16, Hp.Int.35, X.Cyr.3.2.20; more freq. fut. Med. in pass. sense, w)felh/somai Th.6.18, 7.67, Pl.R. 343c, X.Mem.1.6.14, v.l. in Lys.19.61: aor. w)felh/qhn Th.2.39, 5.90, etc.: pf. w)fe/lhmai A.Pr.222, Pl.Grg.512a, etc.: plpf. w)fe/lhto Th.6.60: (o)/felos):—
help, aid, succour, first in Hdt. (v. infr.); opp. bla/ptw, Th.6.14, Pl.Phd.107d; opp. zhmio/w, Isoc.6.5.—Construction: abs.,
to be of use or
service, ta\ mhde\n w)felou=nta A.Pr.44, cf. S.Fr.196, E.IA348(troch.), X.Oec.1.9; ou)de\n w)felei= Th.2.87; to\ polla/kis w)felou=n Isoc.8.35. c. acc. pers.,
to be of service to, benefit, Hdt.2.95, A.Pr.507; ta\s yuxa\s w). dida/skontes X.Cyr.2.3.23; w). tina e)/s ti
to be of use to one towards a thing, Th. 4.75; ti/ de/ m' w)felh/sous' oi( r(uqmoi\ pro\s ta)/lfita; how will rhythms
help me to earn my bread? Ar.Nu.648: abs., e)pi\ toi=s deinoi=sin E.Fr. 84; dia\ tw=n w)/twn Plu.2.38c, cf. 145b: c. part., au)tou\s w)felei= proskei/menon E.Hipp.970. esp. of a general,
enrich his soldiers by booty, Plu.Aem.29; tou\s stratiw/tas w)felhkw\s a)po\ tw=n strateiw=n Id.Caes.12; cf. w)fe/leia 11.3. in Poets also (v. Thom.Mag.p.408R.) c. dat. pers., A.Pr.342, Pers.842, S.Ant.560, E.Or.666, 681, Heracl.681, Ar.Av.421 (lyr.); also in Antipho 6.38, and v.l. in Th. 5.23; the compds. proswfele/w, e)pwfele/w, sunwfele/w also take both constructions. c. gen., dub. in ou)dei\s e)/rwtos tou=d' e)fai/net' w)felw=n S.OC436 (fort. leg. e)/rwt' e)s to/nd'). c. acc. cogn., w)feli/an w). tina to
render him a
service, Pl.R.519e, cf. Euthd.275e; w)feli/an koinh=| -ou=ntai pa/ntes oi( dhmiourgoi/ Id.R.346c: with a neut. Adj., ou)de/n tina w).
to do one no
service, Hdt.3.126, E.Alc.875 (lyr.); polla/, ple/on, plei=ston, w(s plei=sta w). tina, Isoc.3.30, E.Andr.679, 681, Th. 6.14. Pass.,
receive help or
succour, derive profit or
advantage, pro/s tinos from a person or thing, Hdt.2.68; e)/k tinos A.Pr.222, Antipho 3.2.3; a)po/ tinos Th.3.64, X.Oec.1.15, cf. Gorg.Pal.10; u(po/ or para/ tinos, Pl.Grg.512a, Amat.132d; w). tou= no/mou
to derive benefit from . . , Antipho 5.17(dub. l.); tini
by a thing, Th.3.67; dia/ ti ib.13; par' e)mou= w)felei=sqai
to make something out of me, Antipho 2.2.13; e)k tw=n u(mete/rwn
help the mselves, Lys.27.7: esp. of troops,
acquire booty, polla\ para\ th\n stratei/an w). Plu.Cat.Ma.10; w). di' a(rpagh=s Id.Marc. 19; w)felei=sqai pro/s ti
acquire advantage towards a thing, X.Cyn. 5.27: c. part., w)felei=sqai i)dw/n
to be profited by the sight of a thing, Th.2.39: c. adj. neut., ou)de\n w)feloume/nh S.Ant.550: polla\ w)felei=sqai ou)de\n ponou=ntes X.Cyr.3.2.20.

w)fe/l-hma, atos, to/,
a useful or
serviceable thing, service, benefit, A.Pr.251; a)nqrw/poisin w)felh/mata ib.501; of a person, w)= koino\n w)fe/lhma qnhtoi=sin fanei/s ib.613, cf. E.Tr.703. w)felh/mata
things good in themselves, e.g. harmony, goodwill, opp. eu)xrhsth/mata, Stoic.3.23, cf.136. generally,
use, advantage, profit, ti/ dh=ta do/chs . . w). gi/gnetai; S.OC259, cf. X. Hier.10.3; w)felh/mata patri/dos Id.Ages.7.2.

w)fel-h/si^mos, on,
useful, serviceable, profitable, polloi\ me\n e)xqroi/, pau=ra d' w). S.Aj.1022; w). [lo/gos] Ar.Av.317 (troch.).

w)fe/l-hsis, ews, h(,
helping, aiding, hence, like w)fe/leia,
use, service, advantage, S.OC401; soi\ ga\r w). ou)k e)/ni Id.El.1031.

w)fel-hte/os, a, on,
proper to be served, w)felgte/a soi h( po/lis X.Mem.3.6.3. w)felhte/on,
one must serve, th\n po/lin ib.2.1.28.

w)fel-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
helpful, useful, Ph.1.14, Fr.55 H., Arr. Epict.2.10.23, Aristid.Quint.2.9, Dam.Isid.296.
w)fel-i/a, v. w)fe/leia.

w)fe/l-i^mos, on, rarely h, on, Pl.Chrm.174d (dub. l.), R.607d:—
helping, aiding, useful, serviceable, beneficial, sts. of persons, as Id.Men.98c, R.461b (Comp.), X.Mem.2.7.9: but more freq. of things, Th.2.46, etc.; tini to one, E.Ion138 (lyr.), Th.4.44, 7.64, etc.; e)/s ti for a purpose, Id.3.68; pro\s ta\s politei/as Pl.R.607d; u(pe/r tinos X. Cyr.6.2.34; kri/nein ti w). Th.1.22; to\ w). as Subst., Pl.R.457d; to\ u(mi=n w). Th.1.76, cf. E. l. c.: Comp. and Sup., -w/teros, -w/tatos, Th.1.93, Pl.R.461b, Tht.179a. Adv. -mws X.Mem.4.4.1, Pl.Grg.470a, Chrm. 163c: Sup. -w/tata X.Eq.6.1.
w)/fellon, Ep. for w)/felon, aor. 2 of o)fei/lw.
w)/x, w)/x, a magical incantation against fleas, Gp.13.15.9.
w)xei/, Egyptian name of a)tra/facus, Ps.-Dsc.2.119.
w)/xnwn (gen. pl.), dub. sens. in POxy.2146.11 (iii A. D.).

w)/xra, h(,
yellow ochre, Arist.Mete.378a23, Thphr.Lap.40, PCair.Zen.764.13 (iii B. C.), Dsc.5.93, etc. in corn, = e)rusi/bh,
mildew, LXX De.28.22.

w)xr-ai/nw,
make pale or
wan, Orph.A.1308:—Pass.,
to become so, Sor.2.45; opp. e)ruqrai/nomai, S.E.M.7.193, cf. Max.Tyr.34.2. intrans.,
to be or
become so, Nic.Th.254.

w)xr-antiko/s, h/, o/n,
making pale or
wan, only in Adv. -kw=s kinei=sqai, pa/sxein, of jaundiced patients, who see everything with a yellow tinge, S.E.M.7.192, 198.

w)xr-a/w,
turn pale or
wan, w)xrh/santa xro/a Od.11.529; of the sun, Arat.851.

w)xr-i/as, ou, o(,
one of a pale complexion, Arist.Cat.9b32.

w)xr-i/a_sis, ews, h(,
a turning pale, paleness, Sor.1.45, Plot.3.6.3; h( poli/wsis oi(=on w). Plu.2.364b: pl., ib.652d. = w)/xra 11, Thd.Am. 4.9.

w)xr-ia/w, = w)xra/w,
to be pallid, Ar.Nu.103, Ra.307, Com.Adesp.342; w)xrihkw/s Hp.Ep.17; w)xrih/sas Babr.92.8; opp. e)ruqria/w, e)ruqrai/nomai, Arist.Cat.9b31, EN1128b14; of wine, Plu.2.692e.

w)xro-eidh/s, e/s,
pallid, po/nos Suid. v. i)/kteros, prob. in Dsc.5.104.

w)xro/-leukos, on,
of a whitish yellow or
yellowish white, a)/nqos Id.4.42; of wine, Gal.6.336.

w)xro-me/la_s, aina, a^n,
dark and sallow, of sufferers from jaundice, Id.17(2).66; of a type of jaundice, Hp. ap. Herod. Med. in Rh.Mus.49.554.

w)xr-o/mma^tos, on,
pale-eyed, Arist.Phgn.812b8.

w)xro/-canqos, on,
of a pale yellow colour, Gal.14.81.

w)xro-pelio/s, =
luridus, Gloss.

w)xro-poio/s, o/n,
making pale, gloss on Il.7.479 in cod.Mosqu.1.

w)xro/s, a/, o/n,
pale, wan, of complexion, E.Ba.438, Ar.Nu.1016 (anap.), Pl.422, etc.: esp.
pale-yellow, sallow, to\ de\ w). [gi/gnetai] leukou= canqw=| meignume/nou Pl.Ti.68c; of a frog, Batr.81; xrw=ma d' a)si/twn . . gi/netai w)xro/n Alex.162.9(anap.); w)xro\s ka)nupo/dhtos, of a Pythagorean, Theoc.14.6: freq. in Luc. of philosophers, JTr.1, al.; w). kai\ au)xmhro/s, of a miser, Id.Cat.17; of bile, etc., Hp.Int.37, Gal.15.554; to\ w). tou= w)|ou= the
yolk of the egg, Arist.HA560a21; to\ w). the
colour yellow (v. supr.), Id.Cat.12a18; cf. w)/xra.

w)=xros, ou, o( (cf. Hdn.Gr.2.39),
paleness, wanness, esp.
the pale hue of fear, once in Hom., w)=xro/s te/ min ei(=le pareia/s Il.3.35; also in Luc.JTr.1 (adapting Hom.) and late Poets, as An drom. ap. Gal. 14.35, AP5.258 (Paul.Sil.).
birds' pease, Lathyrus Ochrus, Antiph.301, Arist.HA627b17(pl.), Thphr.HP8.3.1, al., CP4.2.2, D.L.2.139.

w)xrosu/nh, h(,
pallor, Antioch.Astr. in Cat.Cod.Astr.1.112.

w)xro/ths, htos, h(,
pallor, Pl.R.474e; xro/as Luc.Icar.5; opp. melani/a, Arist.Cat.9b22: pl., Plu.2.84e; opp. e)ruqh/mata, Arist.MA 701b31.

w)/xrwma, atos, to/,
pallor, interpol. in Suid.

w)/y, h(, EM344.55, but o(, Ar.Byz. (v. infr.), Eust.1426.55 (v. infr.), gen. w)po/s, acc. w)=pa:—
eye, face, countenance, Hom. and Hes., only in acc. sing.; ei)s w)=pa i)de/sqai tini/ to look one in
the face, Il.9.373; e)ph\n e)/lqhte *dio/s t' ei)s w)=pa i)/dhsqe 15.147: abs., deino\s ei)s w)=pa i)de/sqai Od.22.405, cf. 23.107; qeh=|s ei)s w)=pa e)/oiken in
face she is like the goddesses, Il.3.158; ou) me\n ga/r ti kakw=| ei)s w)=pa e)w/|kei Od.1.411; qeh=|s ei)s w)=pa e)i/+skein Hes.Op.62.—masc. acc. pl., mega/lous w)=pas Ar. Byz. ap. Ath.7.287b, cf. Ath.9.367a, Gal.12.804, Eust. l. c.; diglh/nous w)=pas Theoc.Ep.6.2, cf. EM233.32: but ta\ w)=pa Pl.Cra.409c: dat. w)/pessi Max.157. (Cf. o)/y B.）
w)ya/, ta/, = ta\ o)pthth/ria, Hsch.

w)|w/dhs, es,
egg-like, u(gro/ths Arist.HA565a23; skw/lhc Id.GA 733b13:
oval, fia/lion w)iw=[des] IG22.1534.46 (iv B.C.).
